Reviews.Title: “we had to be in mexico 4 days before getting married”
Reviews.Author: KingDin
Reviews.Content: we were getting married at another resort but had to be in mexico a few days before actually getting married so we choose this place to stay before moving to the resort. The rooms were clean , the location was very good. We also roomed most of our family members here that cane down for the wedding as well. everyone had a good time. It was priced well also.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: MLphoto
Reviews.Content: We live on Cozumel and travel to Playa on business regularly. This is where we stay. The service is excellent, the rooms are comfortable and quiet. The location is one block from Quinta, perfectly located to numerous restaurants. The pool is great and the common areas are comfortable. We have looked around, but always come back to Hacienda Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “You be the judge”
Reviews.Author: Jessicaann122
Reviews.Content: I would like to give the hotel a 2 1/2 but there is no such rating. i do not think that the hotel was poor so i will give them an "average" After carefully researching hotels for our vacation, my husband and i chose Hacienda Paradise. I have to say that i was not impressed in the least. cons first, sorry: the complimentary breakfast buffet was mediocre. fruit and yogurt, toast, cereal, and a hot egg dish that was different every day. there is a creepy red lighted hotel that is 3 stories taller than the hotel right next door. the neighboring hotel had LOUD club music thumping ALL NIGHT. it also blocked all the sunlight to the pool so the pool was freezing and uninviting. Had to complain and moved rooms two times due to no hot water. and the kicker: there are bedbugs. my husband didnt get bit but my legs were COVERED in little bites. Pros: the owner of the hotel did comp us an excellent dinner to his friends italian restaurant in return for all the hot water issues, but when you dont have hot water you dont have hot water. the hotel is well located right off the 5th ave and if it wasnt for the red creepy manequin hotel, it would be fairly quiet. the beach is within reach as well all in all, we will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Christina and Ola, Anna and Jan, Falkenberg, Sweden”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaFalkenberg
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and excellent service. Walking distance to beach and city.

Reviews.Title: “customer service sets this hotel apart from all others!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbeasely
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at this little hotel. The rooms, the beds, the hotel in general is a very nice choice, and for us...the only choice. You will not find a better value. We stayed in room 15 which is on 10th, but had no issues with noise. The big advantage this hotel has over all others..customer service! We have been going to playa for at least 7 years, this hotel beats out all others hands down. Their customer service CAN NOT be beat. A great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Stylist85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hacienda Paradise February 14-20 2012. We were referred by friends that stayed here in the past and loved it. I have been to Mexico several times and this was the only time I've never done all inclusive. I absolutely loved this hotel. It is very quaint and relaxing. The staff is WONDERFUL and very attentive to all or any of your needs. Upon arrival, our room was not ready at the 3pm check in time and they apologized up and down and served us welcome martinis....they were fabulous!! We were then checked into our beautiful room 15 minutes after, but they still remained extremely apologetic that we had to wait just an extra few minutes, and told us if we needed ANYTHING to let them know. The housekeeping does an excellent job at decorating. Every day we had beautiful new decorations in our room. The last night we stayed, our housekeeper, Eric, even left us the nicest note on our bed, thanking us for our stay. We made sure to leave him a nice tip at the end of our stay! We also ate breakfast here a couple of times, which is much cheaper than going out to a restaurant. The food every day was fresh and delicious and once again the staff was wonderful! All in all, this was a wonderful, small, relaxing boutique hotel, with a great location. We will definitely highly recommend Hacienda Paradise and will be staying there again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Paradise, Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Playa area at least a dozen times in the past 20 years and this was our best overall experience! From the start to the end of our two week stay, the staff was gracious, helpful, knowledgeable and very accommodating. We arrived about 5:00 p.m. for our checkin and were in our room unpacking literally within minutes .The facility itself was very clean--every day we witnessed the staff cleaning and/or tidying up the areas--both the individual rooms and the common pool, restaurant and lobby areas. We did not have any problems with plumbing, air conditioning, refrigerator, television (could use an English speaking news channel) or facility provided wifi. We did experience a light bulb/electricity problem, but the staff was on it within minutes of the report and it was fixed immediately. The daily breakfasts were varied with plenty of selection and the quality of the food was excellent; could have served more breakfast meats (bacon, ham or sausage). Access to the beach clubs was very good. Going in we were concerned about the distance to the beach, but it only took a couple of days to get used to the walk to the beaches; the locations of the clubs was not a deterrent to the stay and would not be a factor in a return visit. We liked the proximity to 5th Avenue with the added benefit of the quiet, particularly after a day at the beach or dinner and a walk. No question of the great value for the dollar in terms of service, room, and amenities. Will certainly return to Paradise or may try the Illusion, which we "toured" one day on our way to/from the beach. Highly recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “A big letdown!”
Reviews.Author: Worldhitchhiker
Reviews.Content: Cons: Check in was delayed. Housekeeping came in the evening hours to clean our room. Insufficient air conditioners. Noisy refrigerator. Lumpy pillows. Breakfast was poor. Poor customer service. Pros: Great location. You get what you pay for. Its definitely not a boutique hotel. Its more like a motel. Pay a little more and stay at a better place. I would NOT recommend this hotel for any family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nothing out of the ordinary”
Reviews.Author: maja1980
Reviews.Content: We had a Luxury double room with a balcony (I think the only difference from a Standard room is the size and that not all Standards have patio/balcony). Our door was to Avenida 10, but there was no problem with traffic or other noice since the room had double doors. Room was clean and well kept and the bathrooms was well sized. Bed was comfortable but the pillows were quite lumpy and too hard. The only real problem with the room was 1) the refrigorator and a/c are incredibly noisy, I had to sleep with earplugs because of them and 2) a strong smell of mould from the closet in the hallway. There was even mould on the hangers. So we couldn´t use the wardrobe, our clothes would have stunk. We used the cabin and our nightstands instead. I should say that we did not complain about this (or about the pillows) so I do not know if they would have given us another room. Pool area was quiet, we didn't see anyone who used it during our entire stay, so it was very calm. Breakfast is fine, nothing special but it had some warm food, toast, fruit and some sweets. The hotel provides free fresh water in the lobby and in the corridors. Very nice to not have to think about buying water etc! All in all a nice hotel with very friendly staff and a good location, but nothing too special or luxurious (but then the prices are reasonable).

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Master Suite”
Reviews.Author: jjwinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I booked a room online and paid in advance to obtain the rate. I was a little hesitant about that but everything was perfect. The rooms are gourgeous and we even got upgraded to the Master Suite - were we lucky!! This hotel is a block from 5th Ave so perfect location. They offered all the amenities and were very accomodating to all our needs! Would definitely stay here again and would certainly recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: corky1995
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect! Close to 5th avenue for shopping and eating and close enough to the beach to walk. The hotel will also give you a discount on lounges at the beach. The staff is amazing, so friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean. The breakfast was really good as well. I would highly recommend to anyone going to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hacienda Paradise”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSara
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 10 days at this hotel and found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful with a smile every time we encountered them. My daughter found her bed too hard and as soon as we told them, right away, they brought a comfy topper which made the bed lovely. The room was very quiet and we both slept wonderfully. The breakfast for $5/day when you book is well worth it. There is an ample selection of food and it is fresh and tasty. The breakfast area is located outside and is a really nice spot to eat. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The hotel is a short block from all of the action on 5th Ave. where there is endless shopping and reasonable restaurants. Try Carabis on 4th just above 5th. Friends joined us there and we all loved it. Bites on 5th near 30th is very good as well. Check out the restaurants on the internet, every one we tried was great. The hotel is just a few blocks up from the beach. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful 10 days at Hacienda Parasise!”
Reviews.Author: jswcruise
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 10 days. This was our 6th trip to Playa and our first stay at Hacienda. We will definitely be back. All the staff were excellent and the rooms were spacious and clean. Great value and location. Thanks to all!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxed environment, friendly helpful staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: herts_harry
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonable quality boutique hotel in Playa for my first visit. Using Tripadvisor i selected Hacienda Paradise & could not have been more pleased with the choice. The hotel is well located close to 5th Ave, has all necessary faclities. It offers good value accommodation and facilities, is very clean and has a relaxed atmosphere. I would not hesitate to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Geoffpine
Reviews.Content: The only downside was that on the night we arrived the hotel next door had a VERY loud disco that went on until 3 in the morning! Not good and nothing the staff could do seemed to reduce the volume.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & great caring staff”
Reviews.Author: Victoria P
Reviews.Content: I agreed to go to Playa del Carmen, last December, with our son & daughter-in-law, with some trepidation, having been totally unaware of the place. However, after spending 5 nights there, I was completely captivated by all the staff, that was always ready to help in every situation. My room was always kept immaculately clean, & I was pleased & amazed, that, Eric, who took care of my room, was able to find the back to my earring, that I had dropped, & could not find. We looked forward to our breakfasts, which consisted of the usual, fresh fruit , different yogurts & cereals, & different varities of freshly cooked hot, breakfast dishes every morning. I also had a massage done by the massage therapist, who is associated with the hotel, & who was very thorough & knowlegeable in the massage she gave me. The location of the hotel was very convenient to our getting to the beach, & discovering many restaurants, which were easy to walk to. It was just a great experience all the way around, with a "lovely" work staff, who were always ready to help & who made our stay terrific. I hope I'll have a chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Sabrochina
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Playa/the surrounding areas, and found Hacienda Paradise Boutique to have been a great find for our first stay in Playa. Good location with respect to 5th Ave/never needed to take a taxi at all, but a bit far from the ADO stations (and we walk fast...) Pros: - Beach Towels were great-- thick, large, perfect! - The minibar fridge was a lot larger than expected (college fridge sized)-- which was great for storage of breakfast/food items during the week. - The room was clean and simple, which was perfect-- there is a lot of closet/storing things space which was nice, additionally we loved the balcony (shaded view of the garden, but nice nonetheless) - The pool! Refreshingly cold, not busy at all. - Staff were very helpful/friendly: esp. Karla and Eric-- special thanks - Decor/Towel art.... returning to the hotel every night was especially fun-- the towel art was different and interesting every night (though the petals got a little tedious to keep cleaning up!) - FREE PURIFIED WATER: we took day trips and brought our own waterbottles, so this was perfect for us-- we'd refill everyday and venture out-- saved us lots of pesos on plastic waterbottles and water! - It was our anniversary, and the hotel went out of their way to help us celebrate, which was great (and soooo appreciated) Cons: - Lumpy pillows: so, our first night, all of our pillows were lumpy and hard. We went down the next morning, and they had changed two of our pillows to be sleepable, but it would have been nice to have a full set of comfy pillows. - A/C: the hotel's A/C set up is good-- they are trying to keep eco friendly, so they make it so you pretty much can't keep the A/C on when you are out-- which was great, and fine in January. However, whoever engineered the room set-up neglected to think that placing the A/C in the little entry way would not be effective in cooling the body (e.g. living space) of the room. Basically, you'll have a really cold entry/closet area, but the room itself will not cool off too well given the placement of the A/C in relation to the rest of the room. - Breakfast was expensive ($7USD/meal!) and we found it average, so we passed and survived off cheaper local fare - Shower temperature: fluxed rapidly/randomly between hot/cold/lukewarm frequently-- was hard to have a completely warm shower. (not also that playa tap water smells very *strange) - Noise: So HPB is located right next to "Reina Roja", this loud, red, hotel/cage/thingy. While it didn't particularly disturb us most nights (we were on Calle 22-- a pedestrian only street--and as far from RR as possible, which was great), if you happen to catch them on a party night: There was loud loud loud music playing on a Sunday from 10am to past when we finally fell asleep (12:30)... could just have been the BPM festival? Misc: - Beach club (Mamitas) was a bit far-- we got there at ~10:30/11am, and had to trek to the edge of the club to find two seats and an umbrella, but once there was fine (if you don't expect too much service). Expensive drinks... Overall: nice place to stay, we booked far in advance so was a bit cheaper than the usual price. Great "base" for excursions to the surrounding areas (Tulum, Coba, etc.). Comfy, beautiful, and mostly quiet. Would stay again. Jan. 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed and poor!”
Reviews.Author: Lokum123
Reviews.Content: We stayed on december 26-30 and it was not a good experienced. The hotel is just a regular 2 stars hotel, nothing to do with a boutique hotel. 1- They charged over $ 220 and it doesnt even include breakfast. The breakfast was so simple and basic, it was not even worthted to ask and debate for complimentary breakfast. 2- The rooms have a bad moisty smell. After a rain, thhe sewer backed up and my feet were with full of sh** in the shower. The staff was nice and apologitic; however it took us a long debate to move to the 2nd floor. 3- it is in a reasonable location, but i would think it is better to book something by the beach to avoid 300-400 pesos payment for umbrella and chairs every day. we spent most of our time in the mosquito beach club during the day, they are a "true" boutique hotel by the beach with amazing beach mattresses and great central location. We were enving people who were staying there. 4- a noisy location with a red light district type of club / hotel next door, they allow people to swim in their very small pool at 3-4am and hard to sleep... I do not recommend to any of my friends to stay here, the mosquito Beach club is the place to stay in playa!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, service in this hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Betticrockatt
Reviews.Content: On our way from Cancun airport we were party to a tour of some of the purpose built, larger, out of town, spa resorts thanks to number of minibus drop offs. When we entered Playa del Carmen and pulled up outside The Paradise Hacienda, I must admit, it felt a little small and basic by comparison. However as soon as we entered and were greeted by the smiling night staff, we knew this was no bad thing. We were offered water, a quick check in and a sympathetic ear for all our travel tales (19 hours in total from London to Playa) and swiftly shown our basic, but equally comfortawithering with tiny touches such as origami towels and offers to help ourselves to the books in the lobby library. Outside was a hidden, tropical pool area, which was clean and staffed by even more friendly attendants, adding to its authentic character. I would recommend this hotel highly. It's location to town is great, everything is organised and the pool area is quite and relaxing, just what is needed to escape the bustle of Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayaktana
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Not a "fancy" one but really really nice. Worth mentioning is the great hotel team! And Good breakfast, nice small swimming pool. Location close to the beach.. Deffenetly "value for money" hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Frequenttraveller10
Reviews.Content: The best location in the upper part of Playa del Carmen center. One block away from the busy Quinta Avenida, but still very quiet and nice. Large and comportable rooms. Very nice staff, helpful and service minded. You find everything, very good restaurants and bars, just around the corner. We had a super vacation in this hotel. Stayed there totally 10 nights this time. Is stringly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean with awesome location, staff the best I have encountered”
Reviews.Author: rjpawlak
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write hotel reviews, but thought I'd share this one. In short, this hotel has a great location near the beach and 5th avenue. It is extremely convenient, exceedingly clean, and has an incredible staff. The only wrinkles that I encountered were a fair amount of noise form the hotel/club next door, and noisy AC. The former is out of the hotel's control though. The latter was fixed after a conversation with the hotel manager (Giuseppe), who stopped to see how we were doing over breakfast one AM. I want to give these guys 5 stars, but the noise keeps me from doing that. Even so, I would go back to stay at this hotel - it has so much else going for it. We stayed at the hotel for six nights with my mom. They treated all of us with the utmost courtesy and professionalism. My mom, who is a little older, was treated with incredible patience and care. I travel quite a bit for business and pleasure, and have not encountered a better hotel in terms of staff. I would like to thank Christian (our waiter), Eric (our cleaning person), and Karla (front desk) for their special service. I am not the kind of person to heap superlatives on a hotel, but this one really deserves it. I can also recommend a few restaurants in the area: El Asador on Avenida Constituentes (about 2 blocks), The Mayan Bistro (right next door to hotel), and 100% Natural on 5th (awesome juices, and great for the vegetarians in your party). All these restaurants are reasonably priced. I can also recommend Dani Sailing, near Mamitas on the beach, if you want to do any water activities.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: pkil
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of the best option, if you are planing to tour the city, visit all of the historical places and do side-attractions ( snorkeling, Xhu-pa, Tulum, Akumal...etc) Good location: very close to 5th avenue and to the beach Very friendly staff Good price Clean rooms Breakfast is not bad Never used the pool but it seems as nobody does!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Paradise”
Reviews.Author: tskii
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really amazing and the staff were very helpful. Had a beautiful large room which led onto the pool. Beds were huge and power shower was great. This was off season so maybe we were lucky to get the best rooms but certainly it was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting within short walk from beach, restaurants, & shopping”
Reviews.Author: crackedandcrazed
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Playa, and in good part it was because of the hotel, and it's location. The shower was exquisite and the beds very comfey. Only suggestion, is that if you are making phone calls from Playa, to do so from a cyber cafe, as it is very expensive to call from the hotel, and we had the Xperience of the front desk person not hanging up the phone even when the call did not connect. At the end, they did give us a bit of a discount on the phone calls. It was great to have access to free Internet & computers.

Reviews.Title: “Back home after a week stay at the Hacienda Paradise”
Reviews.Author: yowmartin1
Reviews.Content: Read previous post on my first day and impression. The maintenance guy came and tried to locate the remote control to the AC but it somehow had disappeared, they offered me another room (from 4 to 25). There we're still a few mishap during the week, AC worked but was a bit noisy, I had ear plugs so I used them, my friend who was in room 27 had problem with the TV, maintenance fixed it, and she also had a very noisy mini bar fridge. All that aside, as I have mentionned in an earlier post, this remains a very nice hotel, bed are very comfortable and rooms well decorated. We had a good deal through Expedia so I was able to let some of those mishaps pass by, but if I had paid full price, I would have been less tolerant. I am still not over not being able to reserve the type of room you wish to have (King Size beds or 2 double beds), rooms are beimg distributed on a first come first serve basis. Pablo who worked the graveyard shift last night was very helpful and very professional. Thanks Pablo

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yowmartin
Reviews.Content: After reading many positve reviews aboiut the Hacienda Paradise, I decided to try it out. Celebrating my 50th thsi weekend and wanted to treat myself to a nice comfortable room. I must say, i am presently at the hotel, Day 1 of my vacation: We arrived at the hotel around 1:00pm (me and my freind - 2 rooms), our rooms weren't ready, that is expected, they usually cannot garantee check-ins before 3:00pm. I finally got mine around 3:30pm, I had reserved 2 King Size bed through Expedia, we both got 2 doubles, the genteman at the reception apologized, he said the hotel was full capacity, and rooms are distributed on a first come first serve basis, so keep that in mind when making a reservation ( King or Double beds not garanteed) I'm sweatinbg in my room as I am writing this review, there is no remote to adjust the AC, I will have to call the reception and inquire. Rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable and clean... Will report back

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel. Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Louise_79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hacienda from 29th November 2011 for 2 weeks and could not fault it. Our room was located on the ground floor and although we thought we'd booked an upgraded room (this error was down to the travel agent - Jetline travel - do not use them!), this was a standard room but we were more than happy with it - spacious, clean, huge comfortable bed. The location is fantastic - within seconds of the hotel, you're on 5th avenue but it's far away enough for you not to be bothered by any noise at night. You will be spoilt for choice for bars and restaurants nearby, both touristy and more traditional. Even the obvious, more touristy options on 5th are fantastic quality. You will pay more but if you like the hustle and bustle and atmosphere of a busier restaurant, like us, you probably won't mind paying a little extra. We didn't have a bad meal anywhere during our time in Playa. If you fancy something a little less up-market, I can recommend Los Pescadillos (I think) just up the road from the hotel (turn left out of the hotel so you're walking down 10th until you reach the roundabout - this place is opposite the Scotia Bank). Amazing calamari and huge portions of Mexican specialities such as giant burritos and fajitas. The Bohemia beer served in a glass with lime juice was great too. Friendly staff. Another favourite restaurant was Buenos Aires on Calle 6 where we went on our last night for a treat. We had a huge platter of amazing cuts of steak for around £30 - amazing! There are plenty of places to find good inexpensive breakfasts on the roads just off 5th - we didn't have breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on that. Our favourite bar was the Rooftop Bar - a tiny little place overlooking 5th with friendly staff and cheap, strong drinks! The cheapest (and strongest!) cuba libres (50 pesos) and amazing frozen margaritas. Open until 2am which good rock music. We did venture to the Blue Parrot a couple of times (which doesn't get busy until late by the way). Expensive drinks and bad music but OK for a couple of drunken beers and a dance at the end of the night. The beach is gorgeous and only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel offers tickets for use at Mamitas beach club so you can use their sunloungers and umbrellas for $5 per couple per day. You don't have to buy drinks but you can't take your own but we were happy to purchase a few drinks - good service and music on in the background while you chill out with a book....the beach is spotless and safe. Clean, warm sea. Very few people annoying you and lovely to walk down the long stretches at the end of an afternoon's sunbathing. We tended to walk from Mamitas up towards the Senor Frogs end, but not as far, to a lovely bar called Fusion for sunset drinks - they have a band on each night at around 5 which is a perfect end to the afternoon before heading back to get ready for the evening. I'd avoid senor frogs like the plague however - we only ventured in one afternoon to escape a rain shower and it was like Butlins gone wrong - rowdy Americans sat around whooping wearing hats made out of balloons on their heads and loud shouting and music coming from the PA. Needless to say we didn't stay and didn't bother going back! The free water and tea and coffee at the hotel (though the hot water wasn't always hot) was a nice touch, especially after a late night and you haven't bought water. There's free wifi so I could access the net on my phone in my room. There's also 2 PCs in the lobby so you can use those free also. You get given a token for a fresh beach towel each day so no need to pack towels. Despite us having lots of lazy lie-ins, we were rarely disturbed by the cleaners - they wait until you leave the room so don't worry about any early awakenings! It was my husband's birthday whilst we were there so I asked Jorge on reception if he could arrange a little surprise for him that day. Hubby was chuffed to bits to return from our day out to find balloons, decorations, a cake made out of towels (which looked amazing!), plus a little cake and a nice message from the staff in our room. Lovely touch! We have travelled the world a few times over so are quite hard to please with holidays but this is definitely one of our favourite holidays and we hope to return! Top tips: Don't bring any dollars with you. You will get stung with conversion charges. We just brought cash cards and drew out Pesos at the bank (plenty of ATMs around - the bigger banks charge less for withdrawls. Maximum withdrawal per time is 3,000 pesos (£150 approx) and they charged about £1 for the withdrawal. Use your Spanish! We know some conversational Spanish and people in bars and restaurants really appreciate it if you try! Don't feel pressurised to book trips as soon as you arrive. There's plenty of tour operators so lots of availability. We booked trips to Chichen Itza and Isla Mujeres a couple of days in advance, no problem Thank you so much to all at the Hacienda and to Playa! Lovely people, great food, amazing beer and margaritas, gorgeous beach....perfecto! It was an fabulous holiday :)

Reviews.Title: “I found Paradise”
Reviews.Author: worldlywise2009
Reviews.Content: 7 weeks away from home is never an easy trip, but after a few weeks around Mexico including the dreadful resort of Cancun I landed at the Hacienda Paradise and was impressed. For starters I had driven myself 7 hours with a broken wrist in a cast from Uxmal so was not the happiest of chaps, but the reception staff soon melted away my grumps. So welcoming they are here. The hotel is L shaped with a pool in the garden area, palm trees with cotton hammocks to relax and read a book or just snooze. Most people head to the beach so if you’re a fan of quiet like me it's ideal. The shape of the building does however mean that sounds can echo around the hotel and especially in the rooms with ease so if you’re a light sleeper bring ear plugs, but come you must. My first room was at the end of one side of the L and very quiet but the internet connection was not strong enough to connect to work systems, and as this was primarily a work trip they kindly rearranged the other reservations to get me into the room next to reception with a much stronger signal. Unfortunately a much noisier room as there is a bar opposite and a toilet with mega noisy fan next door. But by choice I stayed for the better signal. The staff well what can I say. The owners are too Italian, Robert the reception manager for the group (they have 5 hotels) is too German and the staff too Mexican. Sorry folks joking but I promised Robert a tease. From the maintenance staff (apart from 1 Sunday morning @ 8.30 am ) to the owners, nothing is too much trouble but nobody imposes, they have a great balance and will go out of their way to accommodate you. I would like to list them all so ALL there you are. The hotel is in one of the most central convenient positions possible in Playa del Carmen. It is on 10th between 20 & 22 so in 2 minutes you can be in the best restaurants with the lowest prices and friendliest service. Further down towards 5th & 10th they get pricey and add 20% tips and pull other dodgy stunts. Mega supermarket is a 10 minute walk and there is a great laundrette over the road. The rooms.... Beds are Massive in width, big and I repeat BIG pillows, spacious and tasteful. Big walk in shower with roof mounted shower head as well as a hand held shower. Loads of wardrobe space and a huge fridge to fill with COLD BEER. As I was working needed extension leads and plug boards which they happily provided, the reception and excursion team were more than happy every morning to print the work documents I needed for relatively very little cost. I was due to go back to Cancun for the last 12 days but elected to stay here ,and drive an hour each way each day to Cancun everyday, rather than move. When I return it will be to Playa del Carmen and it will be Hacienda Paradise (or one of their hotels). If you want central with easy access to great bars clubs and great restaurants then stay here you will love it. Thanks guys for a great stay and all your help over the past 40 days. As in the words of the great Arnie. I'll be back x

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing oasis in Party Playa”
Reviews.Content: With it's shady courtyard pool, this small hotel had a refreshing feel to it. It is in a quiet location (great in such a party town as Playa) just one block back from the main drag. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and comfy and clean. Bathroom was great too. Brilliant to have free tea and coffee and water in the lobby. The hotel can send you off to beach clubs such as Mamitas for free too. Highly recommended and really, really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to 5 av!”
Reviews.Author: Ap1090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and was so impressed with this boutique hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean with a beautiful balcony over looking the pool. 1 block from all the restaurants of 5 av. And a short stroll (10 mins) to the beach. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel for a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: JorgeRamirezLopez
Reviews.Content: This is a small and comfortable hotel that offers great location, nice ammenities and friendly staff. The location is the best, one block from 5a avenida and a couple blocks from the beach, five blocks from CocoBongo and a laundry just around the corner. Staff was friendly and helpful every time. Breakfast has not a lot of variety but you will always find something tasteful. They got us a box lunch for all days that we went on tours. This is an excellent choice if you want to explore Playa del Carmen and just spend 3 or 4 hours in the hotel, otherwise you will get bored.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lucybeau3
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice in hotel! The location was fantastic, right next to the main strip, 5th Avenue, with all the shops and restaurants. It is also only a 5 minute walk to the beach! The staff on the reception desk were always very helpful, happy and friendly at all hours of the day. The staff at the concierge were also very friendly and knowledgable. Free wii fi was another great bonus of the hotel! We were also able to use hotel's computers for free and to print off documents that we needed. Our room was very nice and clean with a huge bed and great air con. We never had any problems. I would highly recommend this hotel to someone who wants to be right in the middle of the action rather than in a large resort hotel which all seemed to be very very far away from the shops/restaurants. Most of the lvery arge hotels were not in walking distance of anything good! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: One generally gets what one pays for. Hacienda Paradise is inexpensive but we will pay more next time for a more comfortable hotel. The air conditining is inadequate at best. The plumbing is even worse which results in a poor shower. The staff was courteous but not at all helpful. Small detail, there is no elevator hence you will carry your bags up the stairs unless you are on the first floor. Our small group had three rooms. Each room was unacceptable though one was much worse than the other two. Thank goodness we were at Hacienda Paradise for only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional staff, best hotel I have visited”
Reviews.Author: Bianca0181
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I absolutely loved this hotel! We were not interested in staying at the massive all inclusive resorts and wanted a place a little bit more intimate. We stumbled upon this little gem through the other great reviews on Trip Advisor and are glad for it. THE STAFF - The staff here were amazing and provided friendly and personal service. We arrived late at night and before we even got in the door, the man on reception was already outside greeting us and helping us with our bags. Generally if the staff saw that you were a new face they would go out of their way to introduce themselves and make you feel welcome. Every day our house maid, Yami would delight us by leaving different towel sculptures and petals on the bed - it's a really nice touch. The bar staff were very attentive and made sure we didn't get thirsty - whether we were just sitting outside our room or by the pool. They also brought us olives and I got a free cocktail on one occasion! I know they're just little things but it's the little things that count! The concierge was very helpful in assisting us pick the right tour to do in the area and recommended some great places to eat and beaches to see. One day he arranged for a taxi to take us to Akumal beach and then a 'REAL' Mayan/Mexican restaurant on the way back - at such a cheap price we couldn't believe it - you would never get that in Australia! So to the staff - a VERY BIG THANK YOU! THE ROOM - The room/bathroom was very clean/modern and had a nice Caribbean feel about it. The king sized bed was really comfortable with massive and sleeping pillows which faced the cabinet housing a TV. Shower had 2 shower heads, a rainy one above or you could switch to a power head (good for when you're washing your hair!). Room was on the bottom floor which suited us as it close to the pool and bar and we had table/chairs just outside our patio door. Air conditioning is noisy but this didn't bother us as we passed out pretty easily of a night. LOCATION - Hotel is literally around the corner from the main 5th avenue where all the restaurants and bars are but far enough that you do not hear any noise of a night. We loved that we didn't have to walk far of a night after indulging in some good food and drink. It's probably a 5 min walk to the beach and a long enough walk that you're hot again after walking back but the pool took care of that. AMENITIES - Pool was great, when we stayed there were never that many people around so it was like we had it all to ourselves. The restaurant does basic but tasty food - it probably would be even better with a little more variety on the menu and I think the bar could be open longer but being so close to everything else, it was not a big deal. Living so far away, not sure when we'll be back but hoping it's sooner rather than later! Thanks again - we had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that keeps you smiling”
Reviews.Author: SKS960
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end this boutique hotel was a joy. Even the odd rainy day didn't stop us smiling. We decided to go to Playa almost 6 months ago, but as there were lots of good hotel reviews we could not decide which one to go for. Hacienda Paradise was the right choice! Everything at the Hacienda was great. - It's in a great location, just a short walk to 5th avenue, and a couple of blocks from the beach. - The breakfasts are freshly prepared and there are free hot and cold drinks available whenever you want. - There's free wifi throughout the hotel and it's pretty quick too. They also have two PCs in the lobby if you need a computer. - The rooms are air conditioned, clean and very welcoming after a long day out at Chichen Itza or the Xcaret park. Ours had a small balcony overlooking the pool. - The staff were fantastic. They really do make the difference. They made us feel really special. All the staff were great but Yami the chambermaid was incredible, so helpful and attentive, and every day we were treated to a cute new towel animal! The Hacienda has changed our outlook on what a holiday hotel experience should be like. We'll never stay at a large chain hotel again and would love to visit the Hacienda Paradise again!

Reviews.Title: “Came for three days, stayed a month!”
Reviews.Author: markod70
Reviews.Content: I originally chose the Hacienda Paradise in Playa del Carmen because of the many positive reviews that it had received from prior guests. My girlfriend and I originally booked 3 nights at the hotel as our plans were pretty fluid. The main thing that other reviews have highlighted is the excellent staff and welcoming atmosphere at the hotel. This was evident from the moment I arrived to the moment I left. This hotel really does have the best hotel staff I have ever encountered from the management, to receptionists, to night porters, to kitchen staff, chamber maids and so on. Everyone was so friendly. I really got the feeling that this was genuine too and not fake and part of the job! Over the period of my month stay I had the pleasure of experiencing a number of rooms. The fact that I moved half a dozen times was by no means the hotels fault, in fact quite the opposite, they always went out of their way to accommodate me when I decided to extend my trip again and again!! All of the rooms were very comfortable and quiet. I don't have a single complaint about any of them. Most days upon my return from an excursion or just the beach a new towel sculpture would invariably be waiting for me in my room cleverly made by the attentive housekeeping staff. The breakfast was fresh and tasty and included in my room rate. The staff at breakfast always greeted me with a smile and chit chat. I didn't eat at the hotel any other time so I can't comment on their lunch menu. In the lobby is a concierge service that can book your excursions, taxis, etc. They were super helpful when I had problems with my flight to New York caused by hurricane Irene and spent hours on the phone for me trying to contact my airline. After my girlfriend had to leave to return home for work another friend of mine came to visit for the week. His second day in Playa was his 30th birthday. I decided it would be fun to get him a traditional Mexican piñata. The hotel went out of their way to organise a small party, including cake and piñata. About 15 members of staff turned up to take part. My friend absolutely loved it! After my fifth or sixth extension (I forget) it was time to leave for New York. Annoyingly my bank decided at this point to stop my debit card, despite the fact that I had plenty of money in my account. To cut a long story short, this could have been a very stressful experience but again due to the professionalism of the hotel staff a solution was found that satisfied both parties. In case you haven’t guessed I would not hesitate to return to Hacienda Paradise and would strongly advise anyone planning a trip to Playa to stay at the hotel. Whilst all staff at the hotel were amazing, I do need to say a special thank you to Robert who put up with my witty banter on a daily basis and laughed at the majority of my jokes!! Hasta la Vista!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: LisaO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned for a week in Playa Del Carmen staying at the Hacienda Paradise. We were there from August 20 through August 27. We had a wonderful time and were very pleased with the hotel. The people were great, the room was nice and the location was wonderful. We did not opt for the breakfast in our room price but did enjoy it on 2 occasions during the week. At $7.50 a person it was one of the most economical meals we had during our vacation!! I would not hesitate to stay there on a return trip. It is one block from 5th Avenue !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best quality for the price”
Reviews.Author: LaurenceSG
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in their 20s and stayed at the Hacienda Paradise for ten days in May of 2011. We chose this hotel mainly because of the fair price and the many good reviews we'd read on TripAdvisor. We got there around 4pm and check-in was a breeze. The room was ready and we were located on the first floor. We were reluctant at first to be on the first floor, but we soon realized that we had direct access to the pool from our balcony. The room was very clean, with a comfortable bed,a nice size TV and mini fridge big enough for our many cans of beer. the bathroom was nice and spotless, but at certain specific hours of the day, we had to let the water run for about 5 minutes to get it warm enough, which was not a big deal to us. We had taken the breakfast plan and were mostly satisfied by the options available for breakfast. There was bread, fresh fruits salad, cold cuts, cheese and usually two warm breakfast options. It did get quite redundant after a week or so, so we ate out a couple of times. The pool was kept clean at all times and there were most often loungers available. The staff was always friendly and helpful. We left tip for the maid everyday and we'd find the room spotless everytime we came back from the beach. They even folded our clothes! The mamita's beach club itself is pretty close, with a walk of about ten minutes to get there. When we got there early (around 10 am) we'd get the umbrellas and loungers nearest to the beach, but even when we got there around noon, we'd never be without an umbrella. Mamita's is a beautiful beach for Mexico, and it is not rocky at all in comparison to lots of beaches around Playa. The hotel was close to many restaurants and bars on the 5th Avenue, but not right in the middle of the tourist area. Actually we found out quickly that the most interesting restaurants and barson the 5th were beyond the 20th street. We hung out at La Fe a lot for the cheap beer and nice vibe. Another good thing about being away from the most touristic area was the total absence of noises at night. Overall, it was almost a perfect trip, and we feel extremely pleased that we chose Hacienda Paradise and not an all inclusive on our second visit to Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water in the shower”
Reviews.Author: Jannagu
Reviews.Content: We read some great reviews about the hotel here on trip advisor, that is why we booked it. On our first day there, we got back from the beach and wanted to take shower but there was not hot water!! They kept us waiting for hours until they tried to “fix” the hot water problem. They had no other king rooms available so they could not give us another room as well. Eventually, when I got really angry at them they let us shower in another room (a room with 2 beds). The day after they gave us a new room with hot water. The story does not ends here. On the next day we had hot water problem again. This time they fixed it right away, but still, this whole situation really ruined the relaxing part of our vacation. They did not even offered any kind of compensation for this inconvenience, which would be the most appropriate thing to do. Also, on one of the days they decided that they are closing the pool for the whole day for cleaning without notifying the guests. This was very inconsiderate. The location is in the center, but it’s 15 minute walk to the beach. Usually a 15 minute walk is ok, but when it’s hot at hell outside, those 15 minutes of walking to the beach feel like 1 hour walk. Another downside is the beach club – playa mamitas. You must get there early to get a sun bed and an umbrella. If you get there after 12, you can have a sun bed, but no umbrellas are left. After 13, there are no sun beds as well. I do have some good things to say about the hotel: 1. The breakfast was very good. 2. Rooms were very clean. 3. They offered free drinking water\ tea\ coffee at the reception area. 4. There are computers for guest use and you can also use the printer. This was very convenient since we could do our online check in for the flight and print our boarding passes. Overall – I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back one day to say hola.”
Reviews.Author: 7a7d7s7
Reviews.Content: Although difficult to copy, this hotel could almost be used as a template for how to get it right. Set just a stone's throw from the 5th avenue, this lovely little hotel has very comfortable rooms and enough Mayan chocolate in the refrigerator to keep you smiling. It is very close to the hustle and bustle of the 5th avenue, but for peace and quiet you can stretch out in one of the hammocks around the pool and marvel at their mojitos. And if you like, you'll make a couple of amigos along the way. There's always something to surprise you at breakfast time, it's all freshly made and the service is great. From scrambled eggs and mexican sausages to pancakes and french toast, there's something for everyone. It's all about the staff here and everyone's attentive and willing to give you some tips about what you can do in the immediate area and beyond. And for those all day excursions, you can fill your water bottle up for free, along with coffee, tea and biscuits, and you'll get access to a pretty good wifi network 24/7. Our only qualm is the mini-bar replenishment process. Not everything you take one day is replaced the next, so keep an eye on the itemised bill as it might need a second look. This was our first visit to Mexico and we were completely captivated. We'll certainly be back one day to say hola.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicosinca
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between the 22nd June and the 6th of July. Its a stones through from 5th avenue in Playa del Carmen which is where most of the restaurants, bars and shops are. Its also only a 5 minute walk to the beach. Are room was clean, comfortable with air conditioning. It also had a TV and mini bar. The bathroom with a shower was always clean and there was always hot water. The staff were very helpful friendly and courteous. Raul, Daniella and Jorje in particular were fabulous. We were staying on a bed and breakfast basis which was fine as there are plenty of good restaurants just down the road for lunch and dinner. There was access to the internet via two computers in reception were tea and coffee were also available 24hrs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel which will meet all your needs”
Reviews.Author: smilingcl
Reviews.Content: When we arrived into Playa Del Carmen, the lady at the busstop advised us to get a cab to the hotel as it was a 10/15 min walk from the station with our bags. The cab driver dropped us in the wrong place somehow so we had to walk for 10 mins anyway (note to self - ensure you have the address clearly spelled out in large letters, it is quite simple!). We arrived a bit sweaty and tired and the guys behind the reception welcomed us with big smiles, a cold wet flannel and a cold drink. They also knew who we were which was a nice touch. We got a really thorough introduction to the hotel and it's facilities and then shown to our room which was luxurious in comparison to others we have stayed at on the Mexican coast this trip. The room was beautifully styled, mosquito proofed and had both a fan and air-conditioning which was very welcome. It also had a giant bed and a little balcony. Our price didn't include breakfast so we were given a BOGOF voucher for the first day which then tempted us to eat their breakfast the other 3 days as it was good value for money and quite a spread. Breads, cereals, fruit, eggs, mexican treats, Italian treats etc. The guys on the reception advised us where we could go on the beach to take advantage of discounted food and loungers / umbrellas, the beach was about 5 mins walk away. The hotel is located 3 streets back from the beach, 2 streets back from the beach is the main 'strip' which is a very long road packed with places to eat and shop so there is no shortage of options. It doesn't really have the feel of a caribbean hideaway - much more of a party town. My boyfriend wanted to go diving and the guys at the hotel arranged this for us which was fantastic, we got picked up and dropped off and he got two dives for $100 (US) I think. They also took me along in the bus so I had a new beachy paradise to sit on for the day (complete with bar/food/massage and floaty toy facilities if required). There are many things to recommend about this hotel, but the people were really exceptional, even chopping up coconuts and fruits my other half bought back late at night. They were very accommodating and made for a very memorable stay. Also the price was excellent, particularly in comparison to other places we have stayed on this holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this gorgeous hotel with great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linturnfish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hacienda Paradise for 2 weeks between may and june this year. We had an amazing stay. The staff are some of the most friendly staff I have ever encountered and they are very flexible. there is free tea, coffee and water available at all times and mini supermarkets nearby if you want other drinks which you can keep in your own fridge in your room. We had breakfast on a couple of days as it was not included in our price and it was really good with lots of selection and all freshly prepared. the location is brilliant close to everything but far enough away to feel like you are out of it. Would definitely stay here again, with only a few rooms and a small ppos it is incredibaly friendly. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Amazing charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vladcastro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The rooms are large, quiet and very charming. The people were very atencious and the breakfast is great. The location is great, a few steps from the main touristic street. I wiil come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Mis Hermanas”
Reviews.Author: bluemaria
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at this hotel for Thanksgiving 2010 and it was our first sisters only trip since we have been grown ups. I have been staying in this hotel for a couple of years and usually come alone. As a solo, female traveler, I have never felt more safe. The hotel is small and the staff are extremely personable and professional withou being sterile. They get to know you, are sincerely concerned about your well being as a guest and oh... did I mention the breakfast (which is included in the room rate) is great. Max and the entire staff are tghe epitome of hospitality. They made it so special for my sisters and I. We were even invited to attend the Playa del Carmen jazz festival with some of the staff as they were leaving work. If you go alone or with anyone, stay here. it's an intimate, well run hotel. Not a lot of frills but the atmosphere, the staff.... Phenomenal. and did I mention its right around the corner of Avenida Cinco (5th avenue) where all the action is? Plus a short short walk to the beach. Rates are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, very cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: alicroco
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, spacious room, very clean. Though little details could still be improved mainly in bathroom. Shower door and shower tube fixed in a shoddy way... Otherwise great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is a little paradise”
Reviews.Author: Kristakoo
Reviews.Content: Going to Playa del Carmen you know there's gonna be quite a lot of other too. So you might want to find a place just one block away from all the hassle of la Quinta Avenida. That's what I went for and just loved Hacienda Paradise. They really know how to do it there, and I mean everything. Location is just perfect, the pool is good and the cute little yard just all you need for a nice relaxing at 'home'. Breakfast buffet meets the same quality as everything there, friendly and helpful service, cleanliness&maintenance. And they even have a travel agency cooperation. Had a trip to Cuba from them and it worked just perfectly. But that is Hacienda Paradise - a little paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly staff, beautiful grounds, great location!”
Reviews.Author: marea1999
Reviews.Content: We found Hacienda Paradise through a search for "Pet Friendly" hotels and we're so glad we did! The hotel is elegant but relaxed, the staff is attentive and friendly, and our dog was not only welcomed but addressed by name by the front desk staff. We loved being able to walk one block and be on 5th Avenue and two blocks to the ocean. We loved hanging out poolside at the end of a busy day and listening to all the many languages being spoken there. Breakfast was convenient and delicious right on the beautiful grounds of the hotel. We're actually making plans to visit Playa del Carmen again just so we can stay at Hacienda Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY BRILLIANT!!!”
Reviews.Author: youdbetterbelizeit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over New Year 2010/2011 and had a wonderful stay. The rooms are very clean and comfortable, the staff fantastic, the food delicious, the pool clean, free coffee or tea available 24/7 from the lobby and a cash machine in the lobby too! Close to the beach and beach towels available from the hotel. The area is good in that it is not noisy and very close to all the restaurants, bars, shops, beach, etc. Will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Esserre
Reviews.Content: Nice, cosy hotel located in the heart of playa del carmen not far from the beach and fith avenue. The hotel provides excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: ekcihey
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is well presented and clean and tidy. There was wi-fi generally available throughout the hotel and free Internet access via 2 computers in reception. You could help yourself to free coffee at anytime in reception. The excursion company that is sited in reception can help explain all the different yours. If I was you I’d go to Easy Tours on 5th Ave and use them as they are very cheap and good. We did two tours with them: Chitchen Itza (£33) and Tolum (£55). Both were very interesting; however, remember that it takes about 4 hours each way to Chitchen Itza. Restaurant Breakfast was fine – typical continental breakfast (fruit, cereal, meat cheese, bread etc). My brother is vegan and they were happy to create different options for him as well. I didn’t eat lunch or dinner here so can’t comment on that. Room I had room 21 which had 2 double beds. The rooms were clean and tidy with effective air con and ceiling fan. The beds were a little on the hard side. I paid about £55/night which included B&B. Staff Very friendly and helpful. Outside The main courtyard had a few sunbeds and a small/medium sized pool. I can imagine in summer that there are too few beds as we were stuck for one even in the quiet season. However, as the sun rarely appears in the courtyard due to the high surrounding buildings and trees so it’s no great loss. Location The hotel is in an excellent location for the main amenities. Just 2 minutes walk and you’re on the main street (5th) with all the restaurants and bars. It was early April and very quiet. Even in the main nightclub areas the main bars were fairly empty. Mosquitoes Didn’t see one. Playa Del Carmen. It’s clean and tidy. I got the impression I was in Spain by its general appearance and feel. The Mexican’s are a pleasant bunch all though they are not great barterers. On two occasions when we didn’t go for the deal offered and on walking away we got a few disgruntled comments like ‘skinflint’ and ‘don’t bother coming back later’ – the words ‘burn’ and ‘bridges’ spring to mind. We found it hard to find decent food in many of the restaurants. The only time we had a decent meal was when we went for the dearer restaurants. The food you get in Mexican restaurants in the UK is genaerally far better. As previously mentioned my brother was a vegan and had trouble finding suitable food as Mexican’s seem to live off meat, tortillas and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: northern_girl85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Paradise Boutique hotel for just over a week in March. The hotel was lovely even though a little basic. The main plus point was the staff which were very friendly and helpful Our room was very comfortable and well air conditioned but the shower wasn't great it took 20 mins to heat up in the morning. Most of the time we let it run whilst we got ready. Most days we got a cute animal made from the towels by the cleaner, which was a very nice touch. It was spoilt somewhat by the cleaner throwing away things she thought was rubbish when we still wanted them e.g. half drunk large bottles of water, my partners half a bottle of shaving foam went missing (he had a beard by the end of the holiday!) The front desk staff were amazing. They always gave great suggestions/advice on day trips and made sure we got good offers when using a beach club etc. We never got the impression that we were being 'sold' anything just got frank and reasonable advice which was much appreciated. For value for money this place was great and the area was wonderful. We were not expecting to spend too long at the beach (as we went to Cancun afterwards) so not being that close to the sea was not a problem for us but might be if you only wanted to sunbathe. It was about a ten min walk into the main part of town which was a nice stroll in the evening and meant that the area sounding the hotel was pretty quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hellokimmy
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing say here! Rooms were modern & clean. There was air-conditioning as well as a ceiling fan & the free internet in the room was fast. My favorite part of the room were the comfortable bed & the rainfall shower head. There was also hot shower. Staff were helpful, especially Robert who was extremely nice & always more than happy to recommend the local haunts. The hotel is about three to five minutes walk from the beach & less than a minute's walk from 5th Ave., away from all the noise. We managed to sleep well for the two nights that we were there, which was also during spring break week. All in all, we'll definitely return to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: headelf24
Reviews.Content: We had a warm welcome as soon as we arrived at the property. The room was very clean and had a balcony with a view of the courtyard and pool. Great location within walking distance of the avenue and lots of great restaurants. We had fantastic service throughout our stay. Everyone met us with a smile and everytime we passed the front desk we were asked if we were enjoying ourselves. We had such a great time and experience that we are returning in December with our whole family!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREATEST STAFF & HOTEL STAY - e v e r -”
Reviews.Author: KenKenIAM
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Mexico with my boyfriend from Mar 22 to Mar 29 2011. We stayed at Hacienda Paradise Boutique Hotel the entire time. We booked at HP after reading all the positive reviews and let ME be the one to tell you - OMG THEY WERE 110% right about E V E R Y T H I N G - except for the breakfast ;-P (I'll get to that at the end). OVERALL, this hotel & the staff is simply AMAZING! Best hotel stay ever. For the price we paid on Expedia.ca and the service we received, this hotel is TRULY a GEM - def better than some 5 star hotels we have stayed at elsewhere in other countries. I cannot imagine staying ANYWHERE ELSE IN Playa del Carmen except here!!! To K.I.S.S. here are the things we absolutely LOVED LOVE LOVED about HP: a - FREE wifi in the lobby AND hotel rooms, there are even 2 computers you can use in the lobby, you can even PRINT your boarding passes from here b - FREE cold, bottled water (500ml) at ANY TIME, day or night, just ask the lobby concierge. We abused this ridiculously because whenever we ate out at restaurants, the water was never free (always 15 - 20 pesos) which is not a lot of money but FREE is always better than non-free, so we took advantage of this MULTIPLES a day - esp on REALLY HOT days or before excusions c - FREE tea or coffee in lobby at any time of day - in Playa Del Carmen, tea can cost you between 20-30 pesos. We were on a tight budget, so saving money drinking free tea helped alot d - FREE beach towels to use at Mamita's beach club or wherever else you want to use them - we used them daily, especially for water activities/excursions e - DAILY room service & change of towels/linen as requested. The hotel is really "green" so they will only change towels if you leave them on the floor (that's the way you request towels to be changed). We are also "green" so we tried to to re-use towels at least 1 or 2x. But whenever we left them on the floor, our cleaning lady put fresh ones asap we never had to hunt her down for anything. f - AMAZING STAFF - OMG i have never felt so WELCOMED or like people actually cared about making your stay FANTASTIC than at this hotel >> JORGE "Tours" was simply great - he helped us book 2 of our excursions which were great, and at a discounted price. He also made really excellent recommendations re: restaurants that were not located on 5th Avenue, as we wanted to have the REAL Mexican experience i.e. EAT where the locals are eating. >> JUANITA "Cleaning Lady" was SOO NICE and smiling/helpful - she did a great job tidying our room daily, and it was a real treat to come back to our super clean hotel room at the end of a long day, and lay in a freshly made bed with the fluffed up pillows and cute towel animals she made EVERY day, always a different animal. >> DANIELA/ROBERTO "Reception Staff" -> again, really helpful in providing us daily beach towels and free bottles of water >> JORGE "Kitchen" he was always smiling/friendly at breakfast, and even made us specific egg dishes the 2nd day we got there as we were not fans of their scrambled eggs initially g - BEAUTIFUL ROOM, with all marble bathroom tiles/shower, tiled floors, huge super comfy kingsize bed - we requested a QUIET room facing 22 Norte on the 2nd floor which we got - the balcony overlooked the hotel's pool/courtyard area. JUSST BEAUTIFUL exactly like in the pictures you see posted - it really looks like that. h - GREAT LOCATION - a block away from the hustle & bustle of 5th Avenue, so you can get peace/rest at night and party like a rock star during the day :) The quietest rooms face 22 Norte. LAST.... there was only 1 thing we did NOT overly love about HP - their buffet-style breakfast. Now - they had scrambled eggs, fruit, yogurt, toast, ham, cheese, cereal, coffee/tea, some flan? or cake? we never tried, pancakes and last on SOME DAYS only french toast OR waffles OR crepes (but never all 3). The breakfast is 91 pesos/per person. It's not that the food didn't taste good - it was breakfast like any other place, you can't really go wrong with eggs / toast / cereal - however we felt the overall presentation was lacking in the sense that the food didn't beckon us or appear overwhelming appetizing. But more importantly - there were some staple breakfast food items that were sadly lacking e.g. BACON, SAUSAGE, HASH BROWN/POTATOES, NON-SCRAMBLED EGG CHOICES e.g. made to order omelettes, CROISSANTS, PASTRIES. The HP breakfast is a mixture, but more continental than good full English / American. We are Canadians - but I still like my full/American breakfast lol. We understand that for 91 pesos, you're not gonna get EVERYTHING. But we are really big breakfast people and have had GREAT breakfasts for roughly the same price elsewhere in Canada. Sadly due to sheer laziness we never had breakfast elsewhere except one day at Mayan Bistro across the street - the food was meh but the presentation was FABULOUS. Thus if you are huge on breakfast, I would encourage you to try some other breakfast spots in Playa e.g. Carboncitos, Mayan Bistro etc.. BUT OVERALL - we absolutely LOVED LOVED LOVED this hotel and if we ever return to mexico would stay there in a HEARTBEAT! xPerience hotels is simply 5 star ALL THE WAY!!

Reviews.Title: “An unique experience!”
Reviews.Author: marciafurriel
Reviews.Content: We had a one-of-a-kind experience at the Hotel Hacienda Paradise. It was my first time at a “boutique” hotel, and what amazed me the most was the attention to little details, the kindness of the staff and the feeling that “everything is gonna work just fine” in our vacation! Initially i was afraid about the location (at 10th avenue @20th street, not in the exact middle of the city), but now I know that this was the critical point of my good evaluation! Others hotels are SO in the middle of everything that can be impossible to sleep. Hacienda Paradise is in PERFECT location, right next to the beach, right next to the good restaurants (i personally prefer the ones after 14th street) and away for all the noise and smells that those could bring. Our room had a kingsize bed, a wonderful shower (the water is a bit salty, but i guess it’s a city issue), a cute balcony facing a cute swimming pool, cable TV and air cond. We definitely will come back to Playa Del Carmen, and Hotel Hacienda Paradise will definitely be our first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Still a Fantastic Hotel....why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: yolove2travel
Reviews.Content: I love Mexico, Playa, and this hotel! Second time to Hacienda Paradise and will be back again... The rooms are great! Beds are comfortable, bathroom is modern, everything is kept up to date and looking great.....noticed small improvements from just 9 months ago. Breakfast Buffett includes fresh fruit that is awesome...eggs, cheese, oatmeal, breakfast treats, bread, fresh juice, coffee, etc. This is a definite plus for this hotel. The staff is awesome....very friendly from the moment you arrive. Robert at the desk was especially helpful and the other ladies who worked at the desk were as warm as they are beautiful. Juanita, our Housekeeper did a great job on the room everyday....special touches like towel art, plugging in our phones, making the drapes look unique when we came back at the end of the day......the special touches were appreciated! Jacinto, the maintenance man remembered me from the last visit and went out of his way to recognize me and make me feel like an honored guest... Jorge, Bepe and his entire foodservice staff did an awesome job at breakfast and all day....with the food and drink selections. This hotel has wifi, access to Mamitas (if you buy the package....PAY IN ADVANCE, save money and hassle!) Beach Club....the computers in the hotel lobby were an added bonus as I don't always travel with my laptop... Daniella and Jorge (the concierges in the lobby) were helpful with booking tours, etc. I recommend seeing Yal kul.....in Akumal....this place is better than Xel Ha at a fraction of the price..... I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “It Could Be So Much More”
Reviews.Author: wand3r3r
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 3-night stay @ Hacienda Paradise. This review may be somewhat biased in that we spent our previous 6 nights in Tulum (we love Tulum!). The rooms, swimming pool, and internal courtyard are really nice. The rooms have 2 doubles or 1 true king-sized bed. With high ceilings, a quiet fan, a/c, TV, and an updated bathroom this hotel could and should be rated much higher. Unfortunately, we had some problems with our first room. Not only did it open up to the courtyard restaurant (see pictures) but there was a distinct vinegar smell in the bathroom when we checked in. Originally we thought they used vinegar as a base to clean the glass walls of the shower. But when the odor did not subside by the next day we spoke to Robert (the reception manager) about it. After inspecting the bathroom, he promised to investigate the problem and resolve it before we got back from Mamita's Beach Club that day. When we returned he offered us another room along the quieter corridor which fronts 22nd Street. This room is in a much better location and did not exhibit the rank odor. For the price, the nice rooms, and excellent (and quick) service provided by Robert we rank this hotel as very good but overall there are a few qualifications: - try to stay away from rooms #14, #15, and #17. Not only do they front busy 10th Avenue but in the morning when you open up your curtains, you are confronted by hotel guests eating their breakfast just yards away. - even in our 2nd room we noticed stains(?) on the floor which could have been easily cleaned with a good mopping (we even cleaned a few with a wet towel) but they were there our whole stay. This leads me to believe that hotel staff does not mop the floors on a daily basis. - finally, and this is not a problem with the hotel per se, but the peaceful inner courtyard is partially enclosed by a monstrosity called the Hotel Reina Roja. It is ugly and its 3 stories of netted balconies overlook the courtyard. To summarize, we would stay here again but only because the rooms and service are excellent. The cleanliness is the big issue we have. Hopefully this review will prompt management to take action on this as we would have otherwise rated this hotel much higher. A big thank you to Robert and his staff. Ron & Mari, San Francisco, CA.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at an all inclusive again!”
Reviews.Author: kimberly069
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from a trip to Playa Del Carmen in November when we found an amazing deal at this boutique hotel and decided to return for a "budget" trip. After just having staying at the Riu Palace of Americas (five start luxury) I did not want to set my expectations too high and be disappointed. Trip Advisor offered great traveler reviews and so I felt like even if this place was over rated - I still couldn't go wrong for the amazing price, location, wonderful breakfast by the pool! To be honest, I was so impressed with the service I don't think I'll ever go back to the All Inclusives again. I guess it all depends on what the purpose of your vacation is. If you are wanting to lay by the pool at a resort right on the beach and have servers bring you coctails and dress up to go to a fancy dinner or buffet everynight with low-budget shows - you may not like the boutique experience. HOWEVER if you are someone who feels independent in their travel, spends very little time in the room, wants a good location to come and go from while they go explore on their own - you will certainly love the difference. I must say, we were there 10 days and looked at other boutiques around Playa but none had the QUIET location a block off 5th ave that Hacienda did. The grounds around pool and breakfast patio were lovely, each room has a balcony facing pool. This place is only two stories so very small and intimate. Free internet and beach passes to SenSi beach club (NICE padded chairs). We had WONDERFUL bedding and pillows actually very comfortable for Mexico (usually have hard beds), We had a fridge in our room so could bring some beer back from Walmart to keep on hand. Our maid service was the best! We had a new towel art design waiting for us each day and we had fun leaving little surprises for them each morning along with our tip. The owner was accessible daily and the support staff he employs treats the resort as if he/she is part owner as well. By the time we left, everyone knows your name and is sad to see you leave. I would definately return to this hotel as I have learned I don't need a marble sink or statues at the pool to relax and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant reviews are confirmed.”
Reviews.Author: UsaBeachdog
Reviews.Content: The hospitality and ambience are great and location north of Constitution is in upscale end of Quinta Ave. Hacinde breakfast was excellant. As frequent visitors to Playa, this was our first stay up this end of Quinta, and loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: sfranksOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have spent two weeks at the hotel, and there is not a better place in Playa to be. In the past 5 years we have stayed at other hotels in this town, and none of them hold a candle to this hotel. The service is exceptional; from the concierge service when you walk in here, to the service received by the girls that clean the rooms. These are the people that make this boutique hotel a 5 star. We will definitely be returning here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Believe All The Positive Reviews”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel13
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at this wonderful boutique hotel. If you long for a small, intimate hotel, situated perfectly & offering the best value for your dollar - look no further. Staff from Managers to maids are there to make your stay a pleasurable one. Rooms have comfortable king size beds, high thread count sheets, rainfall shower with either a balcony or patio. If you like the sound of birds in the morning, Bouganvilla outside your window and rose petals on your bed stay at Hacienda Paradise Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: BlueSkySal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay tremendously. The staff always went the extra mile to take care of a large group of friends. We received top-notch service from everyone including our maid, who provided the best towel-art I have ever seen; the chef, who cooked the fish our friends caught; the concierges, who helped with numerous requests; and the wonderful massage therapist who was on-site daily. Our first floor rooms were very convenient and secure. Although it was tempting to just hang out all day in a hammock by the pool, the hotel is just a block away from the hustle & flow of 5th Avenue, a pedestrian-only shopping/dining/bar zone. It's an easy stroll to the beach clubs, too. I'd visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and breakfast - will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: TaylorAtlantaGA
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my 40th birthday here. We brought along family members this time and they absolutely loved it! The staff was great - the decorated our room with balloons, etc and made me a special cake which the entire staff came to my room to bring me and sing Happy Birthday. This is our 2nd time to PdC and the first time we stayed across the street. We will definitely be back to this hotel. It was very close to 5th Ave and the beach, the price was excellent and the breakfasts were wonderful. Also, you get free chairs and umbrellas for Mamita's which alot of other hotels don't give and you must pay - so that alone was a great savings! The staff was quick to fix anything or accomodate any of our needs. Only downsides wase that we had to ask for more towels daily (there never seemed to be enough). Other than that, its a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Reaffirming the many, many positive reviews......”
Reviews.Author: idahojoe83404
Reviews.Content: I suppose that there are others like us. Part of the fun of a vacation is the research and preplanning related to various location and accommodation options. Hacienda Paradise caught my attention. A relatively small hotel, modestly priced, with an exceptionally large number of positive reviews. Every review seemed to emphasize staff quality and attentiveness. Reserving months ahead, in our case for 12 nights (basically nonrefundable if disappointed upon arrival), ups the ante on locating the right lodging. With the help of Trip Advisor and all of the frequently eloquent submissions, we nailed it! From the moment we first approached the reception desk until we were assisted with our bags out the door 12 days later we could not help but feel that the entire staff wished that we had a great stay and that any possible assistance be made available.
