As we daily passed reception, in the restaurant, and in the hallway with housekeeping, we were repeatedly asked if all was well and if there anything additional that could be done. We had a sense that the staff was almost hoping for a challenge, a problem, a need, so that they might swing into high gear and take care of it. I hesitate to make the following comment. This is like revealing a favorite hidden fishing hole on the internet. The Master Suite is a tremendous bargain. I'm not sure, but I believe there is only one. Upon entering it looked like the two rooms had been staged for an advertising photo shoot. Fresh flowers, fresh fruit, iced wine in the bucket, arranged china, red flower petals scattered over bed and hot tub. Excessive storage, great bath, a very private patio. The available pictures do not come close to doing justice. Wonderfully extravagant for two, perfect for three or a family with kids. Playa Mamitas is less than an eight minute leisurely stroll, more if you can't get your wife past Starbucks which is half way. The hotel offers discount coupons at Mamitas Beach Club, but we greatly prefer the adjacent Kool Beach Club. In our experience the staff is friendlier and more attentive, the wooden cushioned lounge chairs are superior, music is subdued and background versus intrusive. So, thank you to all that have previously commented on TA and helped us to find our way to the Hacienda Paradise Hotel and a sincere thank you to the staff and management for a great vacation in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: LC531009
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted to go somewhere warm for his 60 birthday in January, and after deciding that it should be Playa del Carmen, I went on Trip Advisor and started looking for accomodation. We are not "all-inclusive" types. The resorts looked beautiful but we really wanted a boutique hotel and this one seemed to fit the bill after I read the Trip Advisor comments. Hacienda Paradise totally lived up to our expectations! It was a great experience from the moment we entered the doors and were greeted by Marco & Edgar. Our room was clean, comfortable and big enough for what we needed and a small fridge was included so we did put in a couple of things from we bought from Mega and ate these after a day that we were worn out from out trips. The hotel was very clean, the staff super friendly and we felt cared for all the time. The pool was great for us to sit beside - yes it was shaded but then we didn't want to be in the direct sun all the time. Our room had sun directly on our balcony from 10 -12 noon so we sould often sit there and read and have coffee. On my husband's birthday the chef, Jorge, baked a cake and a lot of the staff came to our room to present it to him and sing happy birthday - he was so pleased. The houskeeping staff also put out a cake mad of towels on the bed and then later that evening we went to a restauartn that the concierge, Jorge , had recommended (Casa del Agua) and had a great seafood dinner. Each morning our breakfast was available in the palapa and we so enjoyed that - a mixture of Canadian, Mexican with a little continetal thrown in. We felt safe to leave out things in our room even though there was a room safe. We did leave out our laptop and ereader but did put away our passports and extra money. the location was great. We were close enough to walk everywhere we went within Playa and again felt safe. The Beach was a short walk and we could get a discount coupon, at the hotel desk for a couple of different beach clubs which we took advantage of and greatly enjoyed. the ocean thee is so blue and beautiful! The concierges, Jorge and Edgar and Cassandra were great at recommendations and we took advantage of what they suggested both touristy and local things- and would do most of them again. We would definitely stay here again and hope to do so in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, luxury at a very convenient rates!!”
Reviews.Author: dcarrai
Reviews.Content: I have been working for 4 & 5* Hotels and Resort and luxury cruise lines for over 10 years now, and I am normally not very easy to please... I had a very enjoyable stay: - The service is excellent, personalized and tailored as boutique Hotel should be, as the Hotel Manager meets with all guests during breakfast and busy times, making sure everyone is having a great stay. - Very lovely, charming rooms, (mine opened up straight into the pool area), with luxury amenities and a bathroom I would take home with me. - Great, comfortable beds, comparable to the high Standard ones of Marriott - incredible massage candle light experience at night by the pool, (in the corner there is a small waterfall, once of the most relaxing massages ever!) - The location is great, much better than most 4* hotels of the Hotels in Playa, 5 min walk from beach, 2 steps away from all the night life, restaurants and Bars. - the Price: incredible value for money! I have already recommended this Hotels to friends and Family they asked me about my stay in Playa, I hope this will help others like me, who read the reviews before making the buying decision. Special Thanks to Giuseppe, Max and Team, great job everyone!!! you will see me very soon! Daniele Carrai

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation, excellent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DOTIAINEDINBURGH
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hacienda Paradise. All the previous reviews say it all. The staff are fantastic. They are friendly, helpful and informative. We don't usually "do" hotels preferring to stay in private accommodation but in Mexico, this proved to be far too expensive. Playa del Carmen lovely and if you wander off the beaten track, you can find a selection of traditional Mexican restaurants that aren't quite as pretentious as some on 5th Avenue or nearly as expensive. We are already thinking of going back, if not next January, certainly January 2013. Unfortunately, due to unforeseen weather, we didn't get the chance to visit their sister hotel on the island of Holbox called Las Palapas but will make a point of visiting next time round.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Donnerfairy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hacienda Paradise for 8 nights in January over my birthday week. The staff at this hotel are remarkable; courteous, warm, friendly and helpful. Everyone always has a smile on their face. I came back to my room on my birthday and the the staff decorated my bed with balloons and streamers and left a lovely note. The hotel is kept extremely clean and fresh. Our room was a superior double and was great and had lots of room between the double beds so two travellers are not stumbling into each other. Great deck overlooking the pretty courtyard. We chose the nice breakfast option that they offered and they always had a nice selection of food to choose. I booked many months in advance so our nightly rate was very fair and a good value. The sheets and linens seem to be changed quite frequently and the room was always spotless.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Comfortable Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pnobile340
Reviews.Content: Each year we travel to the Mayan Riviera right after Thanksgiving for 7 days and this was the BEST hotel so far we stayed at. The staff are very attentive and friendly. They accommodated every need that was requested. I have and will continue to tell everyone that this is the best hotel and best location. Best Value ! We are definitely looking to go back and maybe sooner than November 2011. This is the place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, good location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: neuatomic
Reviews.Content: The most outstanding aspect of the hotel is its extremely friendly and accomodating staff, all the way from the manager (Ebersain D Hernandez - great job!) to the concierge, desk folks and cleaning crew. We were treated like royalty and everyone had a smile and hello. Wow. I asked a passing staff member "where can I get a six-pack of Sol". He returned in 5 minutes with the beer!! He insisted - and actually walked down the block to the convenience store and bought it for me (I paid for it, of course). There were several instances like this of the staff going out of their way for us. Hotel is one block off the busy 5th avenida and a couple blocks from the beach - so great location: close but not too close. Playa is not too large (yet) so from here everything is no more than a 10 minute walk. I stayed in both the Master Suite (will leave that for another review - a nice large living room, huge bathroom and bedroom) and a standard room. The standard room was spacious, large bed, reasonably large bathroom, mini-frig and sliding door leading to patio and poolside courtyard. Breakfast was good: mixed fruit, granolas, cereals, eggs, waffles, coffee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “For us an unbeatable price/value trade-off.”
Reviews.Author: 2trex
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel are 95% favorable with a few of the unfavorable ones dating to 2008 when there was construction which is now not an issue. The hotel is truly a boutique hotel: only 34 rooms and a staff which has the time and the desire to help you at every step of the way. We found that our room was quiet even though it had a window onto the busier Avenue 10. The beds were super comfortable; we slept like logs. The breakfast is good but not especially varied: eggs, toast, fruit and yogurt, good juice and good coffee comprised the centerpiece and there were often pancakes or Mexican variations (and occasionally desert pastries) to provide change. I at first took precautions to store my computer in the in-room safe provided, but after a few days of getting to know the staff it became obvious that all of our things were safe in the room so for the rest of our two weeks we never thought about it again. The location on 10th Avenue is, as most people have observed, very good, one block from 5th Avenue when you want to indulge in one of the pricier (pricier for Mexico anyway) restaurants and close to 30th if you want to walk to Mega to pick up some groceries or eat in one of the really affordable local restaurants. The only issue would be for those who wanted to spend time in the Hotel pool or in the sun chairs working on their tans with a drink close at hand. We were there in December and although we went into the attractive pool a few times it was, shall we say, bracing. Also in December and probably the rest of the winter months the sun is so low in the sky that it is blocked by the adjacent hotel and does not really invite to sunbathing. So if that is what you want then you are better off paying more for a hotel on the beach. There is one for example just 250 meters to the east of the Hacienda Paradise for which you will pay roughly 3 to 4 times more per night. Since that was not what we had come to Playa for we were quite content with the price trade-off. We did make the 10 minute trek to Mamita’s beach club twice and although it was a little noisy you can find that same noise level at any beach at home. We also made the slightly longer walk to the other beach club, Wiki’s, and found that a lot quieter. We were in the Master Suite and all I can see is that if the suite is available pay whatever it costs to get it: one extra room, two HD TVs, one DVD/CD player, a bar, a Jacuzzi, (but you have to feel a little bad about wasting all that water in Mexico so we only used it once) and a spacious balcony that, because it was on the second floor did get a couple hours of direct sun in the late morning and early afternoon. All in all, everything we could have asked for.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel!!! Very good!!!”
Reviews.Author: wagsimoni
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel on December 2010 and what can I say....It's very good. The staff is incredible and the people at the frontdesk gives you all attention you need. A especially thanks to Jorge and Edgar (concierges) who helped me if my lost luggage by American Airlines. I just have a complain to do, when we arrived at the hotel the bedsheet was dirty, but I just called to the frontdesk and they changed at the sametime. The location is perfect...near from the 5th avenue, but where you can't listen the noise of the avenue.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: davidn78
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem. If you're looking for a great place to stay in the heart of Playa Del Carmen, this is it. It was very clean, the staff was extremely friendly, and the location was perfect. The beach is only a couple of blocks away and is crystal clear. The breakfast was delicious too. Highly recommended. Great Value. Have a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location: a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: cal_n_ceci
Reviews.Content: I and my wife returned to Playa del Carmen for Thanksgiving 2010, also because of the Jazz festival that was held there. We had no doubt to return to Hacienda Paradise. The reasons are very simple: - Hacienda Paradise is a great deal, compared to the quality of the service you get. The management experience and professionalism is well beyond what you expect for the price you pay. - location is very convenient. Walking distance from the 5, but one block away, so you get a good night sleep. It was also very close to the location of the Jazz festival. We decided to get the all inclusive package. Besides the baseline service, including free Internet, we got the breakfast and free coupons to the beach. By the way, the beach club they have an agreement with is probably the best in Playa. Indeed, it was the location of the Jazz Festival. The breakfast is fresh, very varied, and their espresso coffee is better than many I have had in Italy (and we are Italians). The chef is so genuinely dedicated to his work: once I asked for an apple, and it was presented in a big plate with a decoration all over the edge of the plate. Can you imagine? I just wanted an apple! We had also room service for dinner a few times, when we did not feel going out to a restaurant. Rooms are clean and well decorated. I remember that time that 1 coin fell off my pocket under the bed, and I found it that night on my night stand... it was like 1 peso... I hope we can get to see the Jazz festival next year, and spend some more time in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: K0nstantina
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, friendly staff. Very nice swimming pool. Easy walking distance to beach and town centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff, and great location!!”
Reviews.Author: sl0pez
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hacienda Paradise. My fiance and I stayed there in April of this year and my memories of how lovely the rooms and hotel and staff were, truly make me smile still!! The hotel has a great location, nearby to the busy lively main street and tons of restaurants and shops and of course, the beach. The rooms were immaculate and quaint, and stocked with all the amenities you need, including a little laptop which was a great and useful addition!! It was also so nice to walk into the room after it had been cleaned and greeted by one of the lovely towel designs sprinkled with flower petals! Was a special touch! The daily breakfast was also a very nice touch, with a wide variety of tasty choices. Everyone at the hotel was extremely nice and friendly. They helped us with whatever we needed and were just really nice people. Edgar was the first concierge we met and was really great. I can't wait to go back! If you are looking for a place to stay while in Playa del Carmen, you can not go wrong with Hacienda Paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: tlena75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hacienda Paradise for our 1 year anniversary. When we got to our room we had towel formations with rose pedals and a nice happy anniversary card on the bed. The location is great, 1 block from 5th Ave and about 4 blocks from the beach. The beach club mamitas was great as well. The rooms were very cute and clean. Elena did a great job cleaning our room and even gave me a gift of jewelry that she made herself the day we left. We can't wait to go back to Hacienda Paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LITTLE HOTEL IN PLAYA DEL CARMEN!”
Reviews.Author: mustang649
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Hacienda Paradise Boutique Hotel! The room was small, but very comfortable with a king-sized bed. There was also a very nice large flat screen TV. The bathroom was clean and fairly large, especially the shower. I had a problem with the air conditioning unit the first night - it wasn't cooling properly. I informed the staff about it in the morning and they immediately assigned a person to check it and it was repaired in less than 20 minutes and performed flawlessly the remainder of my stay. The staff was very friendly and attentive to the guest's needs. There are two computers in the lobby area that guests can use for free to access the Internet. The hotel is also in a good location in terms of being close (less than 5 minutes walking distance) to all the shopping and restaurants available on 5th Ave, which is the main strip for those places in Playa del Carmen. It was about a 10-minute walk to the beach and the hotel provides its guests with a beach pass and beach towels. The breakfast in the morning was adequate, although it's not free. The restaurant is only open from 0700-1100 for breakfast, but sandwiches, drinks, etc., are available throughout the day. I was in room 21 and did not have a problem with noise at night - it was very quiet. I would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone who would rather not pay the much higher costs of many of the other hotels in the area, but still have a pleasant and clean place to stay, in close proximity to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, terrific beds, slept like a baby!!”
Reviews.Author: Felizmujer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel one block from all the action on Calle 5. Beds were great, pillows better. Reception was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, excellent service, extremly comfortable beds! :)”
Reviews.Author: PAULINA_roma
Reviews.Content: we've spent 6 nights in this fantastic place! we felt really welcome from the moment of arrival till the check out! there are severall great things about Hacienda Paradise, but the main plus are people working there! Answering with a smile on any single question and showing you that your satisfaction is very important for them. also creative maids make great towel decoration every day :) big thanks to Edgar who gave us names of few local restaurant outside of the touristic center. we've tried all of them and they were all excellent! the rooms are spacios and beds as i mentioned before are reaaaaaaly comfortable! it's quite important when you are out the whole day sightseing, diving, walking around....you really need a good rest during the night! in the bathrooms there is also plenty of space for all your things ( important for females :) ) there is a hairdryer and shower products. Free wifi and free computers in the lobby were very usefull. there is also a tea/cofee at the lobby avaliable 24/7. We've booked also a tour to chicken itza with their concierge and it was very good though we personally prefer to go around on our own ( this time we decided to book a tour cause it was quite far to go by bus and come back the same day and we didnt' want to drive many hours). Great thanks to ALL THE HOTEL staff aspecially Edgar, Casandra e Narciso and our maid Yamilet :) you made our stay special! hope to be back oneday and stay with you again! Paulina and Enrico

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon location for Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: bethany0809
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for ten nights for our honeymoon in May and were so pleased with all aspects. We had originally been booked at the Playa del Karmen (their sister hotel) but due to the businesses changing hands (I think) we were transferred over to the Hacienda Paradise the week before we were due to get married. Needless to say I didn't appreciate the added stress of being moved to a hotel I knew nothing about but the staff were so helpful and upgraded us to the honeymoon package at no extra cost. Breakfasts were delicious and the rooms were pretty and comfortable. Near the end of our honeymoon the airconditioner broke so we were moved swiftly to a different room on the East side of the hotel, however this meant the traffic noise flooded the room so ensure you ask to be placed in a quiet room if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and nice”
Reviews.Author: mtvlbug
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at Hacienda Paradise. The hotel is very close to 5th and walking distance to nice beaches. The staff was courteous and helpful – we would stay there again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A Spectacular Staff and an Awsome Boutique Environment”
Reviews.Author: jmdr04
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Hacienda Paradise Boutique Hotel (May 2009, May 2010). I'm in love with Mexican culture and the people are genuinely the most friendly of my world travels. This Hotel has twice celebrated my birthday with friends and traveling companions with the most delicious creations and without asking for anything because I typically do not celebrate birthdays in the traditional sense these days. You can not make a bad decision with this location, its staff or the excellent food available. The main tourist area 5th Avenue or "Quinta Avenida" has so many shops and restaurants and is 1 block from the hotel. The beach is a comfortable walk of 5-10 minutes and the local life is amazing to explore every night! Our next stay with this organization is Feb 2011 to celebrate a 60th birthday of a friend and I'm still planning a return in May for my 50th! I can't think of any place else I'd rather be when I turn 50!

Reviews.Title: “A Honeymoon in Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: JustBeOne
Reviews.Content: After several visits to Playa Del Carmen, my bride and I decided to try Hacienda Paradise for our honeymoon stay. We opted to purchase the romantic package that included a private ride from and to the airport, wine and fruit in the room, and a massage for two. I also requested that they substitute a six pack of cold Bohemia beer instead of the wine. We were met right outside the airport departure area by our driver and in a short 40 minutes were deposited at the hotel. Our room had been fixed up beautifully with two kissing swans surrounded by flowers on our bed and flower petals spread across the pillows. The cold beer in the wine bucket quenched our thirst from the long trip. Each morning we arose and walked a few steps to the restaurant where a wonderful breakfast buffet was waiting. Our stay, to say the least, was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: IAH
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at HP the first time was in Oct 2009. Simply outstanding the second time too! Clean rooms, helpful staff, lovely grounds, great WIFI, nice pool, fantastic breakfast, GREAT location in Playa! I cannot sing the praises of Hacienda Paradise enough! Stay here, you won't regret it! This hotel in only one of very few that I know of in Playa that is pet friendly!! Although I did not travel with a pet, if I did, I would of course stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent from tip to toe!”
Reviews.Author: traveller20109
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Paradise for an impromptu honeymoon and were over the moon with our choice! We didn't want to stay in an impersonal all inclusive and definitely made the right choice. The room was gorgeous with a HUGE bed, made every day by the wonderful housekeeping team who decorated it with extrordinary towel animals! The bathroom was great as was the huge shower. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, offering restaurant recommendations, organising trips and ensuring our stay was enjoyable overall. The onsite restaurant was fantastic, and was great for snacks or lunch, offering a delicious range of nibbles as well as some great home made pasta specials. The location of the hotel is ideal, one street from 5th avenue (main shops/bar area) and less than 5 minute walk to the beach, and some days the hotel pool is a good alternative. We really cannot fault our stay at the Hacienda Paradise and would like to thank all the staff for making our honeymoon so relaxed and memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Greek22
Reviews.Content: Customer service is great, the best in Playa. Beautiful hotel, quiet very close to the Mamitas beach, delicious breakfast buffet. We truly enjoyed our staying.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: NASN
Reviews.Content: The in-town boutique hotel offers a complete range of services, including concierge and local travel counsel, in-lobby ATM, free wireless, and so much more. Have a look at their website. It's all accurate. All of the the staff (admin; bar/kitchen; concierge; cleaning) were incredibly helpful and kind. I used the the garden and pool area every day; and also enjoyed the short walk through town to the beaches. The concierge helped me arrange some enjoyable side trips. The breakfast and kitchen/bar service were outsanding, with an excellent variety of foods, fruits, drinks, etc. Airport transfer was convenient - it couldn't have been simpler. I had a wonderful stay. I would certainly go back and also highly recommend this place to anyone lookiing for an in-town boutique hotel near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Greate place. Very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: fcnelson
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here. It is a very nice hotel with great rooms. It is near several restaurants and a very short walk to 5th Avenue. Breakfast has a very good selection and is worth the extra $5. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Oh, the beach is a short walk from the hotel, and they usually include free chairs at Mamita's beach. In Playa, you have to pay for the chairs on the beach so this is nice if you go. Lastly, they have free in-room safes, free wi-fi and two computers to use in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Beppe is the highlight however this hotel is all round fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Traveller81
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. We loved the location as it was close to the beach and 5th avenue but not TOO close that you are in the bustle. The pool was really cute, small but who needs a pool when you have the ocean down the road? Loved the free Wifi too, came in handy for researching places to eat and keeping in touch with people! The bathrooms are really nice and the rooms are a good size. We liked the free water and rain shower. The front desk people are very accommodating and the tours desk has some great information about food and tours. Try El Fogon its totally amazing and really cheap for great quality food! Mamitas Beach Club is definitely worth visiting, even if its not included in your hotel price, its so cheap and the beach is great. Plus you can order drinks and food at a reasonable price and meet some great people! The breakfast is very good value, you get eggs and toast and fruit and yoghurt and cakes etc. You can’t possibly leave hungry! Food was delicious too. Keep in mind it does get full quick so you might have to wait but never for too long! The highlight was Giuseppe (Beppe) who works in the bar/cafe at the hotel, from the service to the food to the drinks and best cappuccino's in the country (best in Mexico and the USA) he was just incredible. He really added an extra something to our stay. Nothing is too much trouble and he is so friendly. Try his signature cocktail it’s out of this world. Thank you so much Giuseppe for making our stay so memorable, you are a true asset to this hotel. We hope to come back one day! From Danielle and Phillip - Sydney Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Carena2010
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to relax. My room was large, clean and air conditioned, with a balcony. Staff were helpful and friendly, always. It's located close enough to walk to the beach and downtown, but far enough away from nightclub noise. I would stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Superb & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcast79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this lovely hotel with our 18 month daughter during our 2 week trip in Mexico and it was one of the best accommodations we experienced. Rooms: Stylishly furnished with comfortable beds and plenty of room. Very nice, large bathroom. Very fast and free wi-fi in the rooms and excellent ac. The hotel arranged for a crib for our daughter (the only hotel that had an actual crib and not just a pack'n'play). The bed was very, very comfortable and came with great linens Staff: AMAZING! Everyone was truly friendly, helpful and just a delight to interact with. They were very professional and so affable at the same time. Special thanks to Beppo who was so sweet with our daughter and she just loved him! He even had special meals made for her. Food: The breakfast that is included in the price was excellent. I really liked the fact that they switched the options each day so every morning it was a delightful surprise as to what we would be able to sample Overall: Top notch hotel at en excellent value and superb staff!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again at Hacienda Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TravelerViajante
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at hacienda 6 days and had the best time ever. The property is beautiful and well kept. The rooms are spacious, air conditioned, and very clean. I especially liked how everyday they would put creative decorations on our bed, a very special touch. The breakfast we delicious and the staff very nice all the time. The hotel is located two blocks from the beach and just one block from the 5th ave., where we had access to tons of restaurants, bars and shops. If we visit Playa again, Hacienda will be for sure our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MLoden
Reviews.Content: My family spent 5 days at this lovely Hacienda-style hotel and we were thrilled. The property is clean and well kept. The location couldn't be better, just one short block from "5th Avenue" with plenty of shops and restaurants at our disposal. The hotel has a wonderful breakfast buffet for just a few dollars a day which included fresh fruit, a variety of home baked goods, delicious egg dishes and AMAZING coffee, con leche, of course. The pool, while a bit on the small side, was great for a quick dip and cooling off after a day of sight-seeing. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. This place was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “True Hoteliers”
Reviews.Author: MMTravel55
Reviews.Content: As owners of a small B&B, we always look into detail. Starting from our research, we try to figure out which solution fits us best, and this time we chose Hacienda Paradise. Their promise is excellence in service and customer satisfaction, and so they did. We kept our camouflage throughout the whole of our stay: smiles and support were deliverred to everyone in an indiscriminate way. Oh, by the way, we are a gay couple! We shall clearly recommend this experience to our friends and clients in our hometown. Thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place.”
Reviews.Author: rosiescottsdale
Reviews.Content: Delightful boutique hotel. Excellent staff and great location. Would stay there again absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects. My best hotel experience ever.”
Reviews.Author: Supadappa
Reviews.Content: This is a truely excellent place to stay. My girlfriend called in advance and we got a price of $56 a night. She was told that we would have a room with balcony overlooking the pool but upon arrival we were shown other rooms which we nice but in a corner without balcony. However the member of staff was very helpful and rearranged reservations for us so we could have what we wanted. This was the general pattern of our stay from then on - excellent service. All the staff were friendly and attentive. We were brought complementary drinks whilst we sat by the lovely tropical pool, our fresh towels were folded to look like swans or teddy bears! (although some days we received less towels than on other days). The staff all spoke excellent English. The room was excellent with a huge bed and nice bathroom. The only complaint would be the noise from the main road (try and get a room on the side street) although this was rarely a problem except for the ocassional car horn blown in the middle of the night. otherwise we didn't hear much. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great value with great service for the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: SpencrD
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff was amazing. Yuri, Vanessa, and Edgar were all helpful at the front desk during our 5-night stay, handling every request we had and suggesting great food nearby that the locals would eat at. We stayed in room 12 for the first night and decided to stay an additional 4 nights (in room 3) instead of changing to our previously reserved hotel. Both of those rooms open onto the back courtyard where there was a hammock and pool that never seemed too crowded for us to use. The location was great because it's a block off the main tourist strip (5th Avenue) and near the more recently developed end, so it was quiet and still accessible to everything going on. When we drove, we always found parking somewhere on the block, often right in front of the hotel. We asked for three suggestions as to "where the locals would eat" and were completely happy with what they suggested every time, all within walking distance: for traditional Mexican: "El Fogon" for Sushi: "Sushi Aso" for baked or grilled seafood dishes: "La Pesca" for great fresh fruit shakes, traditional Mexican, seafood, and pasta dishes: "Nativo" (Nativo washes their fruit and vegetables with bottled water, for those of you who are cautious). As for breakfast, we ate the buffet set out at the hotel every morning, which includes quite a bite more food than you would probably expect for a hotel breakfast: yogurt, granola, egg dish, pancake/wallfe/french toast dish, meats, pastries, cereal, coffee, juice, tea, etc. Overall, we loved the environment, the people and the room (which was more spacious than we expected, with a king-size bed, desk, safe, setee, large shower, TV with over 50 cable channels (including many in English). We also got passes to get into the Mamitas Beach Club only about 6 blocks away and for less than $4 got a beach chair and umbrella right on the beach. Thanks to everyone at Hacienda Paradise Hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachbunny82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful boutique hotel for 9 nights. Accommodation is perfect, the rooms are nicely decorated and the bathrooms are clean and provide plenty of space to put things down. The “rain-shower” is great!!!! A real highlight are the staff members. All of them are very pleasant, friendly and helpful. Breakfast has a great selection of hot and cold items and is served in a beautiful courtyard. On Friday’s there is always a special dinner, the food was outstanding and the service great! Thanks Beppe!!! The hotel is very quiet, but very convenient. Just minutes walk away from the hustle and bustle of the 5th Avenue and also only a short stroll from the beautiful beach of Playa del Carmen. We can recommend this hotel at the highest level. It was our first visit, but certainly not the last one!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: davoblue
Reviews.Content: This friendly, intimate hotel is one of the best examples of value in Playa. The staff is superb and helpful, the food is good, and the location is great! I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the middle of a vibrant city centre”
Reviews.Author: 50-Sunblock
Reviews.Content: Having stayed only in big resort hotels the past few years outside of Playa del Carmen, this was our first stay in the city centre. Right from the beginning we were extremely well looked after and everything was organised. We were already expected at the airport and the transfer was pleasant and smooth. We had a very warm welcome at reception and were then shown to our room. Nicely decorated overlooking a lovely courtyard and pool. The bathroom was very clean with a exclusive selection of amenities. You can find lot's of personal touched around the hotel. Whenever you come back to the room in the afternoon, you will be greeted by a new towel arrangement on your bed, inclusive rose petals. The location is great! Whilst it is just a block from the busy and lively 5th Avenue, as soon as you enter the hotel you arrive in a haven of tranquility. The courtyard and pool area, nicely decorated, is the perfect place to relax after returning from the beach or a day trip. The beach is only minutes away and you can take advantage of an arrangement with a great beach club. Hacienda Paradise is a great boutique hotel. Exclusive, professional and extremely customer focused. It was our first stay, but right from the first moment we felt as we would be long known customers. There are some great people working there, Beppe, Jorge and Vanessa, just to mention a few. If you are after a real treat, this is where to go!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE...FOUND!”
Reviews.Author: yolove2travel
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay!...Everything was perfect. It is hard to say what is best about this hotel, the staff, the food, the value you receive, the comfort of the room....everything about this hotel was great! The staff exceeded our expectations, we received mangos fresh from the tree in their beautiful courtyard. The hotel room was VERY comfortable...yes the beds are more comfortable than what they look like online. The breakfast was awesome...different everday.....They have an Italian Chef and Italian Managament that brought added European class to the Mexican beauty and hospitality of this place. We decided to not stay at an all inclusive hotel and do not regret our decision. This hotel is in a perfect location, 1 block from 5th Avenue....where all the shops and restaurants are located!....you are less than 3 blocks away from the beach and the hotel offers discounts to Mamitas Beach Club....We easily found excellent restaurants near the hotel..... Playa Del Carmen is fun, beautiful, safe and an awesome vacation spot.....Hacienda Paradis was beyond our dreams!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: DeborahNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights in Playa del Carmen at the Hacienda Paradise. It was lovely. It is 2 blocks from the beach, pleanty of cafes and places to eat. The beds at the hotel are extremly comfortable and it is quiet. The breakfast was a great way to start the day by the pool. The staff was attentive and helped me with anything I needed. Consierge was in the lobby to plan any day trips to ruins. I would stay there again and I am recommending it to friends who are looking for a small hotel in Mexico near beautiful beaches.

Reviews.Title: “This was a perfect oasis.”
Reviews.Author: kpid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Paradise for the last night of our vacation. We had originally booked Playa del Karma but were upgraded for free to this gem. We (my husband and adult daughter and myself) stayed in the Master Suite where we had a beautiful balcony over looking the pool and garden. The room was cool , clean and very stylish. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is conveniently located just blocks from the bustle of 5th avenue, yet so quiet. The breakfast by the pool was delicious and had something for everyone. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!!!:)”
Reviews.Author: Ryder33
Reviews.Content: very nice staff, good breakfast, clean rooms, pretty lobby, and for family fun go to X-plor and Senotes Azu only 15min (by car) away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Excellent Value, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: gwitt69
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel that is just off of 5th Ave. (the street with all the bars and restaurants). Anyhow the hotel is an older property that has recently been remodeled and is very nice and modern. The property seems to be an old style Mexican hotel, however when adapted with marble and glass bathrooms, beautiful painted walls, nice comfortable beds and all the modern luxuries this hotel really does transform into a boutique 4 star hotel. Lets start with the the rooms, they are very clean and ours was completely insect free. The King Size bed with the pillows was great. The curtains block out a lot of the sun so you get a great night sleep and the bathroom amenities are perfect. The shower has a handhelp shower head as well as a rain spout. The bathrooms are small but complete. Because the hotel is older there can be a small odor of sewer that can come out of the shower, but they provide a plastic topper that will block out the odors in each shower. (this is just part of Mexican construction and is prevalent all over Mexico, even my house in Puerto Vallarta has this issue). Anyway, just close the door to the bathroom and it is NEVER a problem. The bathroom is beautiful and the room is great! The air-conditioning works well and each room has a fan over the bed as well. OVERALL: 10! The breakfast is complete as well, and if you get the room. make sure to get breakfast included as it is a good value. Daily there are eggs and bacon and sausage (hot dogs). Also there is Yogurt, cereal, waffles, fruit, breads, juices, water and usually a different Mexican option each day, sometimes quesadillas, sometimes, chilaquiles, black beans or tacos. If you are expecting American flavors you may be disappointed, but the breakfast is good and tastes good. Remember you are not in the USA. That said, the food is clean, and very tasty. And they also will make you an omelet, smoothie, cappucino, or mixed juice drink for a fee if you like (but the prices are very reasonable). The pool is small and in the pictures looks bigger, but it is very clean. If you are looking for a quick dip even at night, it is a great clean pool. If you book directly with the hotel they give you a pass for Mamitas beach club (valued at about $10) where you get two lounges and an umbrella. The beach is pristine and about 4 blocks from the hotel. The hotel will daily give you fresh and clean towels. Also parking on the street is not usually a problem if you rent a car. This way you can drive out to Tulum, or even the Cenote Azul (about 3 hours away towards Bacalar/Mahajual). All in all I would highly recommend this hotel, for its value, service, cleanliness and location. It really has it all. I will return here in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “the living proof that loyalty rewards”
Reviews.Author: Jonathanhum
Reviews.Content: After my last stay in Playa del Karma I wanted to give it a try and I had the proof that these people are seriously service minded. This is why this time i tried Hacienda Paradise instead (their second property in Playa del carmen) and had even a better feeling. Lovely and comfortable rooms, nice garden and grounds, excellent breakfast and maids made an excellent service (fancy towel decoration different every day). I am heading back to Playa next winter and would not miss the opportunity of staying again in Hacienda Paradise. Super recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: BudAndPam
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a great place to stay! If you don't want to spend the big $$ on an all-inclusive, and want to feel like you're part of the city & not isolated on a big resort, then the Hacienda Paradise is the place to go! All of the staff were wonderful (friendly & helpful), the facilities were top-notch, and you couldn't beat the convenience. A short walk to 5th Avenue (the main tourist spot in town), an ATM in the lobby, and cheap taxis made it easy to enjoy our stay. The concierge even helped us get to a local movie theatre on short notice to see a U.S. movie (an experience you should do if you have some extra time - it was fun!). Highly recommended if you want a place to relax after hitting all the sights during the day. The concierge can arrange tours for you if you need them, too. One warning if you're new to Mexico...you're not supposed to flush toilet paper - that's what the little trash cans next to the toilets are for (there weren't any signs to warn us - but we knew from a previous hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Nice end to our trip”
Reviews.Author: deepsnows
Reviews.Content: We were relocated to the Hacienda Paradise from a sister property, the Playa del Karma. We had originally booked at the Playa del Karma but upon arrival it was undergoing some renovations and were given the option to stay or move to the Hacienda Paradise (at no additional expense, they even offered to pay for a cab). We elected to be moved to the Hacienda Paradise. Our room was relatively clean. They bedspread had a couple of stains as well as the sitting couch located in the room. The bathroom had some mildew on some of the bathroom caulking but nothing that warranted asking for a different room or that was out of the norm for a standard US hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The two computers in the lobby were convenient to confirm remaining travel plans. The hotel courtyard was well maintained and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, comfortable rooms, has it's own beach club!”
Reviews.Author: Nikaot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the 5th Avenue, but still far enough not to be disturbed by night noise. Within walking distance from great restaurants, about 2 blocks from the beach. Hotel also ownes Mamita's Beach club, in my opinion the best beach in Playa, as a hotel guest you can rent a chair and umbrella for only 1,50USD a day, instead of some 7USD. We asked for a room facing calle, not the big avenida, because we read that avenida may be noisy during early mornings. The room was large, with a comfortable king size bed and a small balcony facing pool area. Everything was perfectly clean. Only the a/c was a kind of noisy. Breakfast was served outside near the pool and was just delicious, with a lot of fresh fruit and differently cooked eggs every morning. Free WiFi, safe box in the room, free use of computers in lobby, if u don't have a laptop. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted and needed for 4 days in PDC”
Reviews.Author: DPfromTO
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great location. Beppe at the restaurant/bar was fantastic and really made our stay enjoyable. Try his Beppe Special drink --- the one with the rum, celery and brown sugar. Solid creation. Only possible complaint was the pillows were too fluffy, but that's something my wife almost always complains about! Normally she drags her own pillow wherever we go, but Mexico is a bit far for that kind of nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Plus..Cannot Say Enough”
Reviews.Author: gotceramic
Reviews.Content: am the first to admit I huge snob when it comes to hotels no matter what price I pay. This hotel did not disappoint... top notch, five star, clean, and safe!! I my husband and I stayed here for 10 days to celebrate our 10-year anniversary and the entire staff treated us like we were royalty/family… Sabrina and Giuseppe along with the entire staff (a special shout out to Bepee! We love you Bepee, I miss your Cappuccino xoxo) Our room was perfect, #19 the tree house room as I called it…..it was super quite and privite. I slept like a baby. Location: This is it! A block from fifth avenue couple blocks from the beach. No car or taxi needed. Trust me when I say this, stay here. You don’t need to pay more or look any further. Save your money to do and shop amazing Playa Del Carmen. We cannot wait to go back to see our new friends at Hacienda Paradise. PS: The massages on property rock!

Reviews.Title: “Personalized service amidst sea of impersonal resorts”
Reviews.Author: aria227
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen is such a cool little town with easy access to clean public beaches and yummy restaurants -- there is really no need to hole up in a mega resort. Hacienda provided the perfect resting grounds for exploring and relaxing in Playa. Located a couple of blocks from a gorgeous beach with temperature perfect calm waters, Hacienda wins additional points for being super close to but not in the middle of the rowdiest parts of Fifth Avenue. Clean, comfy beds, rainfall showers, and excellent service -- o, add to that great $30 massages (ask for Lorena!). We already have plans to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: b1j2m3c1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, just 1/2 block from 5th Avenue for easy access yet nice and quiet. We booked the Infinity Plus Package which included a netbook that allowed e-mailing and Skype, a king size bed (which was one of the most comfortable beds in Mexico my wife said she ever slept in), and daily coupons for a palapa and 2 loungers at Playa Mamitas Beach Club, about a 10 minute walk. The package also included very good breakfast that was more than just the usual continental offered by other hotels. It always had eggs, meat, yogurt & fruit, and other items. Request a room on Calle 22 as opposed to Ave 10 as there could be traffic noise from Ave. 10. An excellent value and we would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have chosen better”
Reviews.Author: yvrgoodlife
Reviews.Content: First off hello to Beppe, Elena, Edgar and Jorge from their new Canadian friends. Our experience over 8 days was exactly what we were after - low-key, lots of beach time, and just one excursion day. Let's start with the service philosophy. The staff got to know our names, always smiled and provided great, detailed service. We stayed up at the bar a couple of nights and Beppe made us some fantastic tropical drinks including the best mohito I've ever had. The hotel won't suit the all inclusive traveller - it caters for breakfast and Jorge the concierge can reccommend any restaurant or service you require. But it struck just the right balance between being taken care of (we love the towel art and fabulous shower swag), elegant simplicity, friendliness, and independence to make each day your own. The hotel is about 4 blocks removed from the beach and set back from the fun, boisterous 5th ave but manages to feel like a quiet getaway with it's inner courtyard with pool and hammock. There is a new big hotel called the hotel Rojea adjacent to to the courtyard which seems to be courting a hipster party crowd. Once or twice the music from their rooftop got a bit loud but the managers are working out a good neighbourly relationship to preserve the special quiet space that is the Hotel Hacienda. I'd m the hotel for sweethearts, solo travelers, or groups of 4-6 that want to get adjacent room and want a comfortable, really well priced home base for exploration. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you want a mega resort all inclusive experience with 37 pools a bunch of kids and an infinity experience. We would have loved an ocean view and butler service but that's not what this trip was about. You need to think about what you want out of the experience. It's called a "boutique" hotel but it's not trendy. We found the hotel to be a most engaging and intimate experience, based in simplicity. It's beauty is simple, there is a plushness about the experience but nothing is over the top. They are doing it really well.

Reviews.Title: “Decent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: Badojjo
Reviews.Content: This was a comfortable, clean, hotel with a nice courtyard and restaurant. Our room was clean, the sheets were excellent, mattress was great, the TV worked great and although the room was on the busy street side it was relatively quiet. Everything was very clean and well taken care of. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. Although I would not say this was an amazing place, The stay here provided a comfortable landing for all of our day-trips to ruins, snorkeling, etc. We chose not to stay in an all-inclusive resort so that we could have a more authentic experience with a sense of independence so this suited our needs well. I'd suggest that they have the front desk personnel make more honest suggestions for restaurants based on personal reviews instead of suggesting ones that offer guests "coupons".

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: francesgl
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are spacious with excellent beds and marble baths with rain showers. the grounds and pool are a quiet retreat after a day at the beach. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. Just a short walk to Fifth Ave and the numerous restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was even better”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerr
Reviews.Content: I have been to PDC many times. This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. I first stayed in March 2009 and again in March 2010. I have to say that service this year was even more outstanding than last year. Thanks so much to Sabrina, Rudy, Israel and the entire staff for making my stay so pleasurable. Upon check in, I was given a room on the 10th Ave side of the hotel, which is noisy day and night. I asked to be moved to the Calle 22 side which is much quieter. Within 10 minutes, my request was granted and I was moved to a quieter room facing the pool. My room rate included breakfast and passes to Mamitas every day. The dining area is next to the pool and serves a wonderful assortment of hot and cold breakfast items each morning. The dining room staff goes above and beyond to make sure you're taken care of while dining. It was a nice way to start the day. This hotel is very clean and very boutique-ish. There are all types of people who stay here - singles, couples, families, friends traveling in groups. I really enjoyed it. The beds are Serta Perfect Sleepers and are wonderful! This is a fairly quiet hotel. The dining room is open through the evening hours. I can't say enough about how well the staff treated me and the other guests. The only negative I encountered was the massage room. I had a morning massage scheduled and was caught off guard when we walked into a small, dark, stuffy room at the back of the property. It had two massage tables crammed in which were separated by a curtain and the entry door opened right into the room in full view of both tables. A woman walked into the room while I was getting a massage and set up her table. It was definitely not up to the standards of the rest of the hotel as far as cleanliness or the stylish rooms. My massage was great, but would have been much better had it been in a more suitable room. There is a wonderful grassy area out by the pool where they could do massages. Maybe they'll consider that for next year. PDC has grown tremendously over the past five years. This hotel is a nice little oasis that is far enough removed from the noise and craziness that is 5th Avenue, but close enough to good food, shopping and a great beach.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: runsunandfun
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Playa and had a great experience at Hacienda Paradise. With breakfast included and daily passes to Mamita’s, the hotel is a very good value. The staff was very competent and genuinely friendly (but not in an over syrupy sweet way you sometimes find at the bigger resorts). We stayed in a first floor room on Avenida 10 (the busier street), but unlike other reviewers, we were not bothered at all by the street noise. The air conditioner muffled any noise. The front desk offered to move us to a room on Calle 22 on our third day, but we decided to stay put in our original room on Avenida 10. The rooms were well laid out with plenty of storage. Housekeeping did a great job as well. Like others, we loved the towels shaped as animals and the rainfall shower. Hot water was plentiful (only once did we have to wait a few minutes for it to warm up). The walk to Mamita’s is less than half a mile (0.4 miles to be exact; I measured it with my satellite GPS running watch). You have to watch for cars in a few places, but we enjoyed the walk. During Spring Break week, the crowd at Mamita's was young (mostly from Mexico and Europe). The music was a little loud, but we had fun and met some great young people from all over Mexico. Usually their English was far better than our broken Spanish. Unlike other popular Spring Break places, it wasn't a total drunk fest. The highlight of the hotel for both my husband and I was the little courtyard restaurant. Each morning after our run, we were treated to delicious fruit salads, granolas, and yogurts. There were plenty of hot dishes to choose from & the most amazing green tomato salsa. (Armando and Beppe were kind enough to tell us the ingredients.) The entire restaurant team was eager to please and improvise. One morning, I requested black beans. There were none to be had, but the next day and nearly every day after I received a small dish of black beans. Thanks Beppe and kitchen staff! Another morning, the hotel had run out of black tea, but Eber brought out a delicious cappuccino instead. I’m normally not a coffee drinker, but I thoroughly enjoyed this special treat and very much appreciated the thoughtfulness of Eber. On our last evening, Beppe made us a series of yummy dishes that made for a delightful poolside dinner and dessert. Our favorite restaurants in the area were: 1) Las Cazueles on Calle 26th (a tiny Spanish sidewalk restaurant between Avenida 5 and 10 – very close to the hotel, delicious meals & tapas, and unbelievable prices), 2) Pizza Piola off Calle 38 and 3) Babe’s Noodle Bar on Avenida 5 near 30th. The Mexican restaurants where we ate were decent, but not outstanding. Then again, we are completely spoiled with amazing Mexican restaurants in California.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want an All-Inclusive, you should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: tkmars
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Mexico to relax and enjoy some warm weather away from the cold Northeast US. Rather than pay for many services we would never use at an all inclusive, we decided to look for a good hotel that best matched our needs. The Hacienda Paradise Hotel met every expectation. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Everyone on the staff was pleasant and helpful. Don't pass up the breakfast, it was truly wonderful. Airport transfers (scheduled before arrival) and two days of activities including three destinations were all efficiently arranged by Karma Trails. There were no problems, all went smoothly and as planned. On arrival at Cancun airport, we were met by our driver holdng a card with our name so we could ignore all the others begging for our business. Beach towels and Mamita's beach club passes were supplied and we spent three full days on the white sand and in the crystal blue water. Another great feature of the HPH is it's location, close to everything without the beach front prices. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach and only 1 block from vibrant 5th ave. with it's shops, restaurants, hotels and street performers. There is so much to see we found ourselves there 5 out of 6 nights! By mid-week we realized you can often buy things for about 60-70% of the original price. The HPH is the perfect place to get away for a refreshing vacation, we would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Attention to Client Service”
Reviews.Author: Chula_Banana
Reviews.Content: Travelled here in high season/peak season with a large self-touring group of athletes coming to PDC for a training event. The reservations folks at HP were fabulous, cheerfully entertaining numerous last minute requests for changes to the reservations and people who wanted to add on extra nights at the last minute. Our group members arrived and departed at different times and the hotel handled us all beautifully and always with a smile. One of our members injured himself early in the trip and the hotel moved him to a ground floor room no problem. I repeatedly saw the staff handle unusual requests from other guests with flexibility and accomodation that is atypical of Mexico. Our air conditioner broke and it was fixed in 1/2 an hour. The maids learned what we were up to and shaped our towels into themes from our sports event - it was a really special personal touch. What set the hotel apart from many of the others we've experienced is that the staff had the capacity to solve problems for their clients without needing authorization from management. And they were willing and happy to do so. The hotel itself, like many others have said, is simple and in the middle of things and offers great value. It can be a bit noisy if you're right off of 10th and the a/c units can make a racket too. Don't stay here if you don't want to be in the middle of it all. Not for everyone for all things, but a great hotel. And the service is really first class.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: mruvolo98
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we chose this hotel based on the reviews. The reviews were more or less spot on, and I will reiterate some of the more salient points. Service The hotel prides themselves on service, and this comes across during your stay. This is not a 5 star hotel, but the intent is to be accommodating, which I find helpful when traveling abroad. The hotel appears to take feedback into account to improve their service. For example, when we checked in, the manager was clear to point out that the beach club was not included (per our reservation) and that there would be a charge of $5USD if we chose to use the service. This appeared to be in response to previous reviews where people were surprised at the charges on the final bill. A few other experiences worth noting: One day we mistakenly left a t-shirt in the beach towel deposit, and it was freshly washed and ready for us the next morning. One day the hot water in our shower ran out. We called the front desk at around 10pm, and they had it working by morning. The two free water bottles per day in your room are a very nice touch, and much needed for long days out in the sun. The hotel offers you fresh beach towels each morning (for use on or offsite), which was also very convenient. One afternoon the shampoo was not replenished, but when I went to inquire for an additional bottle I was brought 5. Prior to the trip we wrote the hotel to request a room on 22nd street. We were informed that all those rooms were booked by repeat customers, but when we checked in we were taken to one on 22nd street. The free computer terminals are helpful for planning day trips and reading up on restaurant reviews. If only the online check in for our airline had been working properly as well.... Noise We had no trouble with noise at night. I imagine you may hear more street traffic along 10th avenue, which is somewhat comparable to NY city street traffic (minus sirens). However, hotels along 5th avenue (between 1st and 32nd street) will have more noise due to heavy foot traffic/late night tourists. Breakfast We did not order the breakfast package with our reservation, so I am unable to comment. Pricing seemed in line with advertised breakfast menus along 5th avenue. Drinks Unexpectedly, the hotel bar had the best drinks we sampled during our trip. Margaritas in Playa in general were not very good; this one was more of a martini style and very strong. The pina coladas were very refreshing with fresh coconut mixed in, but more of lighter drink. El Bistro on 5th and 24th also had tasty fruit drinks (and a great value during happy hour), but for those looking for a strong margarita, the hotel bar is a good bet. Pool Area/Courtyard The courtyard/pool area is small but nice with lots of plants to give it a tropical feel. We especially enjoyed the view from our balcony, and the hammock by the pool is a nice touch. Given that the beach is 4 blocks away, we did not spend much time at the pool, but that is to be expected unless you are staying at a large resort. There are mosquitos/bugs on the property (and in Playa, in general), and I got bitten on a number of occasions (mostly foot area) while on hotel property, all of them at night and at times despite bug spray. However, my boyfriend did not get bitten at all (even without any spray), which is consistent with the mixed comments from reviewers. Finally, a rather obtrusive looking hotel has been built on the adjacent property (La Reina Roja), extending above the courtyard walls (the Hacienda property is L-shaped as opposed to completely enclosed). It would have been nice if the rooms that border the courtyard of the Hacienda Hotel had been painted a more neutral shade instead of a dark grey with industrial trim. Location Great location from which to explore Playa. Right off 5th avenue between the two main hot spots (8-14th streets and 24-30th streets). Short walk to the beach. We spent half our time in Playa and half exploring the Yucatan (cenotes, ruins, etc.), and found the hotel location to be a great base for exploring the area. Final Bill Be sure to review the final bill. We were mistakenly charged for a hotel breakfast, but this was removed after we disputed it. Additionally, the hotel charges a $2USD/day charity fee in partnership with a local charity. This is optional, but is presented on the final bill as standard charge (and not something entirely comfortable negotiating about at the end of the stay). The one thing that seemed strange in connection with the charge was that there was an additional sales tax associated with the charity fee (generally donations are don't have fees or taxes associated with them). The hotel does not match contributions on a dollar for dollar basis, but they apparently offer transportation services, etc., to the group. My recommendation would be for the hotel to have a dedicated web page/tab regarding their sponsorship, with a link to the organization's website for verification/additional research purposes. I would also recommend that they leave a copy of the final bill under the guest room door on the day of check out, which is standard at US hotels and helps you review/reconcile beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but situated on a noisy street.”
Reviews.Author: NinaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week long vacation in Playa Del Carmen. We chose Hotel Hacienda Paradise after considering many different hotels in this area. I am not too concerned about staying in a luxury hotel but I do like to have a peaceful environment and a comfortable bed. Knowing how much Playa has grown in recent years, I was really concerned about the noise level in our hotel. We requested a room on the 22nd as it a quieter side street. When making my reservation I made it very clear that quiet/relaxed environment was the most important thing to us. Nevertheless, when we got there, we were put in the room that was located on the 10th. There was no option of changing rooms that night so we had to sleep in this room and it was REALLY noisy. The room had no privacy because the back door opened up to the courtyard where everyone gathers for breakfast. Fortunately, we were moved the following day to a quieter room with a lot more privacy. Likes: Rooms are clean and have plenty of space (especially ones located on the upper floor Upstairs rooms are private. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Comfortable beds Close proximity to the 5th. Dislikes: You can definitely hear the noise from the 10th Mamita's beach is noisy and overcrowded. If you are 20 and looking for a party atmosphere, this is perfect. Make sure to check on your final bill that you don't get charged for the passes to this beach. This happened to us but they took if off promptly when we asked about it. It is a little deceiving when they say that the hotel is only 2 blocks away from the beach, it's more like 10-15 min walk. This is a comfortable and clean hotel, however, it is in the middle of everything which wasn't exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel13
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon Hacienda Paradise, while strolling the streets of Playa del Carmen. Upon seeing a room, I was able to change hotels, and we spent the last three nights of our vacation there. Spacious room/with rose petals on the bed, beautiful furniture, terrace over-looked the pool area, rainfall shower in a great bathroom while being in an excellent location. The staff is very accomodating and professional, complementary water, beach towels and passes to Mamitas are available at the front desk. I have no qualms in recommending this hotel to family or friends. It really made my vacation!

Reviews.Title: “North-end Boutique Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: organikate
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Paradise is located on the north end of Playa del Carmen, one block west of Fifth Avenue and about 4 blocks from the beach. It's located on a busy street, which is great for hailing taxis. The room was beautifully, if sparsely, appointed. It was clean and had a little patio that opened onto the pool courtyard. The pool looked nice but didn't receive much sunlight and I never saw anyone swimming in it. Free breakfast was a large buffet and very good. The service at the hotel overall is excellent and I think that's what they really strive for. If you want a nice hotel in a busy part of town, this is a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarbiniBridgeport_CT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay at the Hacienda Paradise Boutique Hotel. This was our 6th trip to Playa del Carmen and the 1st time at this hotel. This is by far the best hotel we have stayed at in PDC. The hotel is very well managed. The staff is well trained and ready to help in any way they can. There are lots of amenities that you won’t find elsewhere: Complimentary bottles of water, along with a hot and cold water cooler in the lobby. Safe deposit boxes that are large enough to hold a laptop. Organic toiletries like shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, body wash and soap replaced in your room daily. Beach towels and free access to the Mamitas Beach Club. Two computers in the lobby for guest use, so usually one is always available. Plus, we had free phone calls to the U.S. (one 10 minute call each day at no charge) . And the hotel is in a great location just around the corner from the best section of 5th Avenue. The included breakfast buffet is fantastic. There is something to please everyone and always in adundance. Most of the other hotels only include a continental breakfast, so this was a real treat. Our room was beautifully decorated. A king size bed that was super comfortable with lots of pillows. Lovely marble bathroom with plenty of space to put your stuff. Maid service was terrific – every day when we returned from the beach our room was ready. We highly recommend this hotel and doubt you can find better in all of PDC for the price.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: pkann
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Hacienda Paradise for 9 nights from Feb.22 . The greeting by the staff was quite warm and pleasant. Rudy at the desk was more than helpful on more than one occasion. Check in took about 5 minutes total which was very nice if you've ever checked in to a big resort before! We went to our room(29) and were very surprised by the large size and amenities included. Breakfast was quite good, they have yogurt, fruit and granola, eggs, crepes , cereal ,toast, coffee, juice which is really a large selection considering it's included. The restaraunt staff is very good and friendly. We booked a tour to Xcaret thru the concierge in the lobby and it was very enjoyable. Again, from a big resort, you would have to stop and pick up people on the way, we went straight there and back with 4 people in the van. This was our first trip to Playa not going to a big all inclusive, but it won't be the last! this is definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back for the excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ScottandKate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hacienda Paradise in February 2010 for a week of vacation. We couldn't have had a better experience. The staff and owners all go out of their way to make guests feel at home . Any request was met with immediate satisfaction. Between the great service, clean and very nice room, the great price, and central location, we couldn't have been happier.

Reviews.Title: “Beatifully furnished & comfortable rooms, cheerful & attentive staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: 2retire2
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly, cheerful and courteous. The rooms seemed recently remodeled and were beautifully furnished. Although the hotel is on a main road we didn't hear the road noise. The hotel is a short walk to the beach and just a few blocks from the road that's closed off for tourists to walk down for restaurants and shopping. The hotel provides coupons for beach chairs from a hotel on the beach and coupons to work out at a fitness center. The complimentary breakfast was good but my only suggestion for improvement is for more variety for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “super friendly and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: bluesgrrl
Reviews.Content: I went with a group of girlfriends and this location was ideal. Staff were great, we were greeted with water and warm towels on arrival. The bar/restaurant was fun, outdoor by the pool. And the drinks are STRONG. Good breakfast daily. Free internet is a plus. Walking distance to restaurants beach 5th ave. I'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful breakfast, great value”
Reviews.Author: Trout10Maryland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well run. There is WiFi everywhere in the hotel and 2 computers set up for use 24/7 in the lobby. There is a concierge on duty daily and lots of knowledgeable staff for questions. The location is perfect, 1 block from 5th, the walking and and shopping street, 5 blocks from Mega, the huge supermarket/shopping store, and 3+ blocks from the beach club. All in all, this hotel is a great value and we will be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingtoturkey
Reviews.Content: great staff, helpful and friendly. nice pool and free internet/wifi, and free coffee/tea/ bottled water. really strong drinks at the bar and good food at the hotel. very very reasonably priced! i would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Hacienda Paradise”
Reviews.Author: peter2008bethesda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for seven days and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff is very accomodating, the rooms are very well maintained and the breakfast is delightful. Their is free WiFi, small pool, and concierge for travel arrangements. This is a great place if you want to explore the restaurants and do your own thing while in Playa del Carmen. Many thanks to the receptionist RUDY for his helpful and friendly manner!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip; great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler005
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from a stay in Playa (3/04 to 3/08). My thoughts: - We took the ADO Bus from Cancun airport, which was painless and simple. BUT, be aware that as you walk out of the airport, you're going to be hounded by dozens of individuals attempting to get you to take their car/shuttle. Fight thru it and get to the end of the terminal where the ADO bus arrives. Once in Playa, simply hop into a cab and 10 pesos later you're at the front door of the hotel. - When booking, request a room on Calles 22 (the street on the north end of the building) OR something on the bottom floor of Av 10. I had requested this and unfortunately when we first arrived we were placed in a room on the second floor facing Av 10. The noise from cars driving past is very distracting and echos into the room. I didn't think it would bother me, but it was somewhat unbearable. - We asked the front desk to move us to a different room (citing the fact that I had emailed ahead of time and was told at the time that we were going to be on the first floor, on calles 22) and they were extremely accommodating and had us in a new room the next afternoon. What impressed me the most: we had forgotten our toiletries in the shower when gathering up our stuff for them to move while we went out to the beach, but they did not...they had them in the shower for us in the new room...AND they remembered to take the beer we had in the fridge and move that as well. :-) - If you're used to a little bit of walking, the location is not an issue at all; I actually preferred being on Av 10 versus Av 5 or on the beach. It's a short walk (5 blocks or so) to the Matimas beach club. The beach club was a great luxury, but I'd advise you to get there before 9:30 am...it seemed to quickly get crowded and the best spots taken. - Av 5 in the evening is fun to walk around; we didn't realize until our last morning that we never walked north of Calles 22, so I'm not sure what's up that way but there was definitely a lot of activity going south and there was never a feeling of being 'unsafe'. In first looking at a trip to Playa, I had concerns that there would be too much of a "WHOO HOO SPRING BREAK 2010!!!!" college-age/underage crowd (I'm 33, She's 25)...was relieved to find that it's more laid back and a nice mixture of age, though this may have been due in part to the time of year...I believe spring break for most American universities is later on this month. - We used the concierge desk to sign up for a snorkeling trip to Cozumel...not sure the name of the package, but they have a partnership with one company and it was amazing. They'll pick you up at the hotel, drive you to the ferry, have tickets for you to board and are waiting for you on the other side. The snorkeling was just right, not too long, and not too short. 35 minutes-ish at three different locations along the coast. The weather that day was a bit chilly...remember to bring beach towels with you to dry off. - Never bothered with the hotel pool; the area is quite shaded and since the temp never got above 82, it was a little on the cold side. If you're looking for a hotel with a nice hotel bar/restaurant/pool/several amenities...this place isn't for you. Definitely think of it as a boutique hotel. All in all, I'd say the positive reviews are accurate and the negative comments seem to be the exceptions to the norm. If I were to make another trip to Playa, I'd certainly choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bweberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as an overnight stop on our way south to Mahahual. The location of the hotel is just fine for wandering out to the main drag and all the shops and restaurants and easy to find from the Cancun airport. However, the hotel is overpriced for what you get, which is reasonable service, a simple breakfast and only an average room. Ours was located on the west side along 10th street which was noisy all night, and one floor over the modest breakfast area which started to buzz with activity early in the morning...more noise.
