The bed was comfy, but everything else about the room seemed a bit threadbare and in need of upgrade...except for the nice shower (no bathtub, but that's OK). I think there are better deals in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: hazelhazel
Reviews.Content: You have options when you travel, particularly in the Playa del Carmen area. You can do an all-inclusive, too often overpriced and "vanilla" and often a taxi drive to the town, or a condo which gives you all the amenities of home but with no helping hand whatsoever, a fancy hotel which charges you extra for everything, OR our choice: the Hacienda Paradise, a small, perfectly located hotel right in the heart of Playa del Carmen. We chose this property for many reasons. The reviewers on tripadvisor loved it, and they're usually right. I called direct to the hotel and had all my questions answered accurately and efficiently. By the time I got there, I already felt like part of the family, rare for a hotel these days. What we wanted was a hotel with breakfast, but not just any breakfast. A full breakfast served in a nice courtyard setting, complete with fresh fruit, yogurt, Mexican eggs (how do they make them so tasty?) and numerous other tempting offerings, plus some really good coffee. That's what we found. The staff is phenomenal, and both Giuseppe and Max make a really good espresso! (Just ask them.) No better way to start the day. So that's the plan. Have a filling breakfast. Explore the city on foot. Walk a couple of blocks to the Mamitas Beach Club (by 9am to assure an umbrella) with the free coupons from the hotel, for chair and umbrella rental, enjoy some of the most blue water you'll see anywhere, have a nice casual lunch in what seemed to be about 1000 different options, none too pretentious (see: Cancun), take an afternoon siesta back at the hotel on their plush bedding, enjoy their pristine bathrooms, minibar, and cable TV and AC. And did I mention the complimentary coffee, tea and FREE internet in the lobby? And if you want to bump it up one more notch, see if you can stay in their Master Suite, not much more than the cost of their regular room. Now your vacation becomes a 2-room suite with bar, large couch, double sized balcony, two large flat-screen TVs, a CD/DVD player, and IN-ROOM laptop computer, and as my wife put it, a bathroom "to die for", complete with a jacuzzi in its own separate space. We spent more time in the jacuzzi than the pool. That's how nice it was. Great staff, great deal, great location. They lent us umbrellas for the short short time it drizzled outside. They have a concierge right on the premises who'll arrange any excursions. Their airport transfers worked perfectly. They all speak English (and Spanish and Italian, and even some Dutch!). Everything is super clean. And yes, you'll get the rose petals on the beds, and the towel animals as well. The hotel knows we're all on vacation. They do their job, and they do it well. Oh, and they take credit cards for everything, another rarity in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: pflores72001
Reviews.Content: Cute little hotel, perfectly located in Playa. Nice to be 1 block from 5th Avenida, and 4 short ones from the beach. The staff is great, very eager to be of assistance and definitely improved the quality of our vacation. Free breakfast is nice, as is the free beach club access. 1 complaint would be that we chose the "change rooms" option to save money, and our 2nd room had beds that were not nearly as comfortable. Wish we had brought our little dog, as he would have been welcomed with open arms.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets.”
Reviews.Author: elsalsero
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Riviera Maya several times, I and my wife decided to finally rely on the web reviews and our search stopped when we hit Hacienda paradise. It is good value for the money, rooms are very clean, the staff is very polite, discrete, never too intruding and always care about your well being. The grounds are constantly being cleaned. The restaurant offers a variety of dishes for breakfast and again is excellent value for money. The real strength though is their staff. We have never been treated so well even in the glamorous 5 stars All Inclusive where we have been several times. You can feel it right at the time of reservation, when Sabrina and Marta are doing an excellent job in creating the expectations they will surely keep during the stay! They will do all they can to please you. We heard about the noise complaint but we did not notice anything of that sort. We guess sometimes people just like to complain about something that is maybe real for them but don’t necessarily represent a ‘threat’ to others. We noticed them working on certain rooms, installing an extra door between the main one and the bedroom. Can’t think of a better solution if external noise happened to be the problem. We definitely recommend this hotel but and we’ll be back in July. Tom, Julie

Reviews.Title: “For the price, you simply can't beat Hacienda Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: jdv913
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a short, spur-of-the-moment getaway just 5 weeks prior to our arrival in Playa. We wanted a total escape: low key and quiet; just give me a beach chair, a margarita and temperatures above 70 degrees. Maybe it was the fact that we were only here for 4 nights, or maybe it was the sun (our bodies in shock?) or maybe the margaritas -- but we unexpectedly fell for this little town and the Hacienda Paradise was, well, a slice of paradise. The staff could not do enough for you. Our first night I asked for a bathrobe and although I had some trouble communicating exactly what I wanted, somehow, a bathrobe materialized at my door. Nothing was too much trouble and everything was done with a smile. The breakfast was lovely. You must understand: it's not the Ritz, but it's lightyears beyond Courtyard Marriott in the States. The coffee is delicious, with fresh fruit of melon, pineapple and papaya; 2 flavors of yogurt; granola; eggs; a mexican entree; assorted meats & cheese; at least one or two sweets; sausage (similar to hotdogs, really); pancakes or similar; juices; tea; toast; etc. What more could you want? The rooms are spotless and the maid service is wonderful. Our room was nicely appointed and comfortable, with surprisingly good storage areas. It smelled divine; not too perfumey but sweetly pleasant. The bed was comfortable and we had no trouble with noise. The only downsides were minimal: the towels were a little scratchy, especially after sun and the pillows were not the most comfortable. Our shower was nice, but did take a good 5 minutes to get hot (but once hot, it remained so for a long time). Bottom line: we already booked for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel. Clean rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: romney1138
Reviews.Content: The Hacienda Paradise is well located off of Quinta Avenida, the main drag in Playa. The rooms are clean, and the hotel is staffed by friendly people. The included breakfast buffet was good. We had a room with a balcony that overlooked the pool, which was nice. I liked that it was a small hotel. The room decor is new and fairly chic, as were the bathrooms. Our room was quiet. It's possible that there are some rooms on the busier street, but ours wasn't one of them. The shower had a nice rain spigot and plenty of pressure and hot water. They supply you with two bottles of water in your room per day at no extra charge. **Important Travel Info!!** Don't take the overpriced shuttle from the airport to Playa. It's $30 US per person and is crammed full with WAY too many stops! Take the bus to Playa and then a cab from the bus stop to the hotel instead. It'll be way cheaper and faster.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things...”
Reviews.Author: Randolf_Terwilliger
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Hacienda Paradise and it certainly lived up to the lofty praise. Upon our arrival (after a lengthy in flight delay during our trip down to Playa) Eber, the bartender extraordinaire, fixed us what would end up being THE BEST margarita in Playa. The staff was both friendly and attentive (oh and they ALL speak very good English). The rooms were cleaned daily and "interesting" towel art was often found on the bed upon our return from a day's adventure. They also offer a variety of complimentary quality shampoo/conditioner AND ALOE BODY WASH (which saved the day after a less than comprehensive sun tan application). The location is also great as the hotel is located a block from the main walking st. (5th Ave). Be ware though, the hotel IS located on the corner of a fairly busy road so be sure to request a balcony room (w/ king bed) on 22nd Ave (NOT 10th). Our room was quiet and secluded. Plenty of on street parking is available. We both HIGHLY recommend this hotel. Great price. Really helped to make our vacation so successful.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute, comfortable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jenulistk
Reviews.Content: A couple of blocks from the beach, this is a quiet, cozy, hotel with friendly and attentive employees. It was my first time to Playa del Carmen and I didn't make the reservations, so I had no expectations. I stayed in the master suite, which I highly recommend for couples. It was spacious, clean, and just overall a great experience. While at first I had wished we stayed right on the beach, after seeing what Playa was all about, it didn't really matter. I actually enjoyed the quiet of our hotel, a block away from the hustle and bustle of shoppers and party goers.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a low key, quiet Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: live2trvl65
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights here in January 2010. The location is wonderful, just a block from 5th Ave. But don't limit yourself to 5th. There are some great restaurants and shopping on the side streets. And the price drops considerably when you move off 5th. There is a MEGA and a Walmart not far from the hotel that we stocked up at for drinks and snacks. The beach was a bit of a hike from the hotel but not bad. Be organized and remember all your gear. The beach in Playa is beautiful. You can literally walk for hours. We thought that the Mamitas Beach Club passes were included in our booking but they were only included with direct bookings. It was only about 5 dollars for an umbrella and 2 chairs for the day. Get there early as it fills up fast. You need to sit on the public portion of the beach if you want to consume your own food and drink and use a cooler, or be very discreet at Mamitas. The breakfast at the hotel was fine for my liking...a good selection everyday. The restaurant staff were great. Bepe, the restaurant manager liked to experiment on our group with his new drinks and recipes. He loves to cook and if you want a special meal or drink, he is willing to come up with something to your liking. Our room was beautiful and very clean. We never used the pool while we were there, but we sat in the pool area every day. The bathrooms were very nice. I loved the shower! We always had hot water with lots of pressure. Our a/c worked well but others in our group had problems. There was an occasional issue with smell from the drains but was easily resolved. The beds were firm and I slept like a log the whole time. Our rooms backed onto the quiet side street but others who backed onto 10th found it noisy. The hotel staff went above and beyond and made our stay so pleasant. We wouldn't stay at this hotel again for the length of time we were there. There are no acitivities and not much sun in the courtyard. But if you are looking for a really quiet, low key holiday, it is perfect. I'm glad I visited the Caribbean side of Mexico but will return to Puerto Vallarta next year as in my opinion it has more character.

Reviews.Title: “Good. But so noisy !!”
Reviews.Author: stefparis11
Reviews.Content: Location is good. Bedroom are quite nice with a small balcony. Internet inside the hotel. Small swimming pool. But it is so noisy. Don't expect to sleep without ear plugs if your room is on the main street. Staff is friendly. We asked them to change for another room more quiet but it was full. I would not stay here again. Ratio price quality is not as I expected reading all the comments here on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: CandCPhilly
Reviews.Content: We felt welcome from the minute we walked into Hacienda Paradise. The transition from 20 degree weather in Philadelphia to 85 degree weather in Playa del Carmen was not easy. By the time we dragged our suitcases into the lobby of Hacienda Paradise, we were sweating up a storm. I just began to tell Leon at reception that we had a reservation, when he asked, "Would you like a cold drink?" Leon promptly reached into the fridge and poured us each an ice cold orange drink. Ahhhhhhhh!!!!! Clearly, our comfort was Leon's first priority. The business transaction of check-in could wait. This delightful first encounter set the tone for the rest of our four night stay at Hacienda Paradise. The hotel features a delicious and varied breakfast buffet each morning, which included fresh cut fruit, yogurt, choice of granolas, a variety of baked goods, cold cuts, cheese, a selection of hot items that changed daily such as scrambled eggs with ham, huevos rancheros, french toast, pancakes, etc. There was also orange or pineapple juice, coffee and tea, plus the staff could make cappuccino, espresso and other beverages to order. My reason for detailing the breakfast offerings is to respond, in a way, to the comment from the Winnipeg travelers that the breakfast was "alright, but nothing to write home about." To the contrary, breakfast at Hacienda Paradise was fresh, varied and excellent. Moreover, lingering over coffee is encouraged and the guests never feel pressured to "turn the table." Unlimited free high-speed internet access is available at two terminals in the lobby - a rare feature at a Riviera Maya resort. The front desk staff is always available to provide information about restaurants and attractions. Need laundry service? No problem. Drop off the laundry in the morning and the clean clothes will be delivered to your room later the same day - and at a very reasonable price. We found that the front desk staff quickly got to know us and greeted us warmly not only in the hotel, but also when crossing paths in town. Rooms were impeccably clean and comfortable. Each room has either a balcony or terrace facing the central courtyard, pool and restaurant. The large sliders make the room bright. The hotel is well located. Nearly everything you could want - the beach, fine restaurants, shops, banks and services - are all within easy walking distance of Hacienda Paradise. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up for the Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: Paradisse
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hacienda from Feb 6-9th. The staff was very friendly. We had a room on the 2nd Floor and they helped carry our luggage to the room. The room had a king size bed and a balcony over looking the pool and court yard area. The bed was very comfortable. There was a bit of strange noise coming from the air conditioner but it was tolerable. Our room faced 22nd Street and there was no real problem with noise. The breakfast everyday was good but not amazing. For free I think it was better than most. The concierge was also very nice and helpful. We did receive the free passes for Mamitas beach club. We went there on our first day and it was very, very crowded. There are people everywhere, including lots of locals. The next day we went back to Mamitas but this time we paid to rent a beach bed which was fantastic and worth every penny! The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the beach, as others have described. 5th Avenue is just seconds from the front door which was great. The lobby of the hotel has 2 computers with free internet as well as filtered water, tea, coffee, and cookies 24 hours a day. At night there is security in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for what we paid. Jan 29-Feb 12/10, Val from Canada”
Reviews.Author: ValCanadian
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly and always wanted to help. We rented the hotel van a couple of times with the driver, Nabor and he was great! Our rooms were cleaned well and the washrooms near the front desk and restaurant were always clean. It was nice to be so close to 5th ave. However the noise from 10th ave was a bit loud at night from the traffic but I got used to it. You may want to request a room that your door faces 22nd street if you are a light sleeper. The beach club is about a ten minute walk from the hotel. The beach club was included in our rooms however if you aren't at the beach by 9 a.m. you won't get a umbrella. The pool is not heated but most of us went in anyways as the weather was hot. Just so you know the hotel only accepts credit cards and cash, NO travellers cheques. FYI the Walmart & MegaMart do not take American Express US funds travellers cheques either as they did a few years back. You can cash them with proper ID for pesos at the Scotia Bank which is only a couple of minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is very quiet which was good for us but the young people in our group would prefer it to be more lively. Hope some of the comments help you for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly and helpful staff, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: GGRIRL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from a 10 night stay in Playa del Carmen and had the time of our lives. We stayed at 2 hotels: the less expensive Hotel Hacienda Paradise and Secrets Maroma Beach (which I will review separately). Our idea was to book a less expensive, clean hotel, preferably offering at least breakfast for the first part of the trip so we could spend most of the day outside the hotel sightseeing, shopping, dining out and going on tours to the ruins and ecological parks. We didn't see the point in spending hundreds of dollars per day if we wouldn't be at the hotel most of the day. We just wanted a place to eat breakfast before starting the day, shower and sleep. Hotel Hacienda Paradise more than met our expectations for this purpose. Pro's: 1. Hacienda style breakfast every morning included in the daily rate, it offered more options than a continental breakfast and there were different things every day: scrambled eggs (prepared differently every day), toast, yogurt with granola, cereal assortment, mexican specialties, cold cuts and pastries. It was pretty good, nothing amazing. 2. Staff was friendly and helpful, always a plus! 3. Location- for us it was a good location because it was right next to Quinta Avenida, but not on it which would have been too noisy. We walked everywhere and it was very doable (believe me I'm lazy!). There's a large supermarket, lots of restaurants and shops, even a Wal-mart nearby. 4. Rooms, hotel lobby-The hotel itself is lovely, nicely decorated. It was noisy in the early evening but by bedtime it had quieted down and the noise was not a problem. The A/C temperature cannot be controlled so if you like for it be very cool ,it's not gonna happen. 5. Value for your money, you get what you pain for and I thought it was more than fair. Cons: 1. Breakfast was served at 7:30 at the earliest, which is fine, however most of the tour buses leave at 7:45 to 8 am , leaving you little time to have breakfast. This is minor but it was inconvenient for us. 2. Pool- It's small and kept clean, but the main issue is that it's in a very shaded area so the water is very cold. I did not see anyone get in the pool the whole time I was there (My husband and I never used it). 3. Cleanliness- The hotel and rooms were kept clean, however there were stains on the bedspreads and in the shower, which was very unappealing. 4. Beds/mattresses- These were on the hard side, not very comfortable to be honest. 5. Beach- Is not that close and not that impressive, we didn't care to much about this since we were staying at Secrets later on which has an amazing beach. However if this is the only hotel you're staying out and the beach is one the main reasons you're coming to Playa this is something to think about. Overall I think the good outweighed the bad and I would return to this hotel and recommend it to a friend for the same purpose we used it. Feel free to contact me with questions

Reviews.Title: “Average boutique hotel located much too far from the beach for my taste - C”
Reviews.Author: VegasPisces
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hacienda Paradise Boutique Hotel for the Christmas/NYE holiday 2009/2010. Overall, the hotel wasn't bad, per se, but the vacation experience wasn't nearly as relaxing as we had hoped it would be. If you are planning on traveling to Playa del Carmen generally, and this hotel specifically, with small children, here are some personal observations that you may find helpful: 1. Playa del Carmen isn't very kid friendly. The only reason I even looked at traveling to this beach destination in Mexico is because it was so highly rated as a family destination in Trip Advisors "Trip Ideas" drop down on the main webpage. This region of the Mexican Riviera has many shops, bars and restaurants along the Avenida Qince (5th Avenue), which are great if you are traveling with teenagers or as a couple, but not really for younger children. Also, the main beach for the area is at least 6 blocks away from the hotel, which was quite a walk with little ones especially after a long day of playing in the waves. We didn't pack a stroller because we had so much other luggage, so it was a very long week of lugging around 3 yr old little boys! The beach itself is rather small and quickly becomes crowded. The vibe there was more like a night club, with loud music and people partying. Once again, I'm fine with this on my own and think that teens would love it, but it just isn't ideal for little ones. Finally, the beach club with which the hotel is affiliated, Mamasitas, was very frustrating. We booked the Master Suite at Hacienda Paradise, which came with access to the beach club. As such, we were given vouchers and towels on a daily basis. Nevertheless, when we arrived at the beach club each day, it was a huge hassle to secure our seats and umbrella, with even more headache when we tried to order food or drinks. This area of Mexico seems very popular with the locals, which was actually one of the reasons I was excited to go there, but that fact worked against us at the beach club, where we were treated like the less important guests. Overall, I would not recommend Playa del Carmen - at least outside of a non-inclusive - for a family traveling with small children. 2. The hotel itself was charming, but overall average - As I mentioned above, we booked the Master Suite for a week, which was great because it gave us some privacy when traveling with our little ones. The main room had a fold out couch/futon type bed that worked perfectly for our boys. They had a big flat screen tv and dvd player to watch all of their favorite videos, which was perfect. I thought that the a/c worked fine and didn't really have a problem with ambient noise, even though we were there during a very busy time. The Master Suite also has an in-room laptop, which was a little tough to figure out at first but overall very convenient. The included breakfast was pretty good - not the best I've ever had, but certainly not the worst. The staff was genuinely friendly and the room was well cared for, with the housekeeping staff even decorating the room with balloons for the boys on NYE, which was a nice touch. The pool was very small and completely blocked from the sun due to its interior location, so we never stayed there instead opting daily for the trek down to the beach. It would have been nice to have the pool as an option. 3. If you do go with little ones, don't miss Dolphin Discovery! We booked a day trip there through the hotel and it was definitely the highlight of our visit. The kids asked to go back each day thereafter. Overall, I think my reservations about recommending this hotel have more to do with my disappointment in Playa del Carmen as a kid friendly destination than the hotel itself. Either way, I just didn't think that this venue had enough going for it to make it truly memorable. Even if I did go back to Playa, I would want to stay elsewhere as there were many hotels and condos closer to the beach than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Sweet”
Reviews.Author: John_McAllister
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hacienda Paradise and booked the Xperience package that is promoted on the hotel's website. Do note that if you book the Xperience package you may be asked to change rooms during your stay. We were lucky enough not to have to move. The rooms are modern and spacious with the bed being the most comfortable we ever had in Mexico. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, which was buffet style and included fruit salad, eggs, hot cakes, yogurt, juice, etc. The beach towels were also a nice touch. We did have free pass to the beach club, but we chose not to use the beach club as the drink prices can be rather expensive. There are cheaper places to drink and relax on the beach or just buy a styrofoam cooler at Walmart, pick up some ice and beer from a mom and pop shop and away you go. Just don't take the cooler to the beach club as it is not allowed. The staff were super friendly and went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant one. And the organic soaps and shampoos were very good. The courtyard surrounding the pool is also very pretty. Nice and quiet hotel. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location & Friendly Staff at a cute little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ToniaOR
Reviews.Content: 3 of my sisters and I stayed here for 4 nights in February. The staff was friendly and helpful, even before we'd arrived they had answered email questions. It was useful to have a copy of the rate and details when we checked in. Hacienda Paradise has a pleasant little lobby with 2 computers and bottled water and tea/coffee. The room we had, with 2 queens, was ground level with slider door access to the little breakfast area and pool area, which was very convenient. Not a huge room, but it did have a mini-bar and safe and a nice sized bathroom with glass-enclosed shower stall and 2 complimentary bottles of water a day. The beds are on the hard side, but not impossible. There is a remote controlled air conditioner and you can set the temperature on it - ask for extra blankets if you tend to get cold at night. The location is great - just one block off the walking street of 5th Ave, and I don't think I would have wanted to be on 5th Ave, since it is open late. The hotel has a nice little breakfast area with coffee, tea, juice, yogurt, granola, eggs, toast, cheese, etc.. You can order omelettes or smoothies, but they'll be extra. The small but quiet pool area is also in the central courtyard next to the breakfast area. The hotel has an arrangement with Mamita's Beach Club, so we were able to walk a short ways to 28th and down to the beach with towels from the hotel, and use vouchers for beach chairs and an umbrella once we got to Mamita's area. The sand and beach and water are beautiful! The thing that makes a difference at Hacienda is the quality of the staff - Guiseppe, Jorge, Beppe and others are genuinely nice and helpful. By the way, their sister hotels are Aqualuna and Karma, a few blocks away. We did spend one night at Aqualuna too, but it was convenient to have breakfast just out our door at Hacienda, rather than the short walk from Aqualuna. Enjoy your stay in Playa del Carmen and certainly check out Hacienda Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, good size clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: jrenck
Reviews.Content: Well, all said in the title really! It's a couple of blocks from the beach, which is probably the only negative point although most hotels in Playa are a couple of blocks off the beach. When I go back to Playa, i will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “People, People, People and Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Great_Dane23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 10 day stay at Hacienda Paradise. It's ratings on TA was a major reason for our decision. We weren't disappointed. Their motto is "infinite hospitality" and they stand up to their motto. The staff, from top to bottom, did everything they could to make our stay pleasurable. Certainly there are a few "rough edges" at the hotel, but they are far outweighed by the friendliness and hard working hotel staff. In short the PEOPLE are number one. Muchas gracias! Our room was very clean and comfortable, if a bit 'plain'. The beds were hard, as many are in Mexico, and to our liking. We were on the ground floor and it was only a few steps to the lounge furniture around the pool. Many earlier comments have mentioned the construction issues with the adjoining hotel. Looks like things are improving as this hotel is nearing completion. However, there were still periods when power saw and hammering noise was distracting. From our observation the Manager of HP was attempting to deal with their 'neighbors' and resolve the issues as quickly as possible. It certainly isn't an easy situation. Having been to Playa several times before we spent probably more time at the hotel than most guests would. We ate a fair number of meals at the hotel besides the complimentary Hacienda Breakfast. From a number of lunches and one special evening dinner it's clear that many guests are missing the boat by eating most of their meals on 5th Avenue. Meals were tasty and fun thanks to Bepe and his staff at a reasonable price. Erbe provided drinks, at the restaurant, as well as around the pool that were great. Located just a very short block off 5th Avenue made the "Location" a strong second plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well managed small and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kitesurfertoo
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying here and will be returning for a furher week there in late February. The concierge Jorge was excellent and helpful, front desk staff were delightful and so were the restaurant and cleaning staff. Breakfasts were very good with fresh fruit salad and a good choice of other items. The twin beds were very comfortable being firm just as we like it. The shower was warm and had a good flow. Bottles of cold water were provided gratis at reception. Self service tea/coffee was available in the lobby at all times. The free wi-fi was most convenient. One could swim in the pool despite it being smallish but of reasonable size for this 30 or so room small hotel. The hotel location is on the edge of the shopping and restaurant area with a couple of good value local restaurants nearby. It is sad that the rear of the structurally complete, new and adjacent, Reina Roja hotel (front view https://booking.ihotelier.com/istay/hotelimages/73731/73731_0_5_1.jpg ) heavily overlooks the Hacienda's internal garden and pool. There was some very occasional drilling sounds coming by day from the work finishing the inside of the Reina Roja.

Reviews.Title: “Small Issue but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: PlayaScubaChick
Reviews.Content: First, I'll start with the issue: I booked the room online for 5 nights through their website. It was all paid for upfront. When I arrived, they didn't have confirmation of my reservation! Even after I showed them the printout, I was simply given a headshake. I pressed a little bit more and the man went into some room and came back and indeed found my reservation. But he said that the rate was different and I had to pay $5/more per night. I said 'no'. I paid in full already. After some consideration, he backed down. This is NOT how one should start their vacation....being stressed out. After checking in, I didn't have to deal with the front desk again. So, everything was fine. The hotel itself is beautiful!! The grounds/pool area are very well kept. My room was the nicest room I've stayed in in a budget or moderate priced hotel. I had a huge king bed with oversized pillows. T.V. and wetbar. I loved the bathroom!! Nice fixtures!! I had a balconey room overlooking the pool. Great Security at night!!I I used their transportation service to and from the airport. They were waiting for me when I arrived with my name on a sign. Very nice!! I'd stay here again. I'm just leery about the check in process. Especially when I paid in full.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greenie-300
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. The location was great, the rooms were very nice and comfortable. The bed was super comfortable. We did the xperience deal so we had passes to the beach club included as well as drinks from the mini bar. The bathroom was clean, good shower and well thought out design with shelf space to spread out. There was a net book in the room as well as free wifi which was very convenient. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. The breakfast was included and pretty decent - buffet style - eggs, toast, granola, yogurt, pancakes some days, crepes others. We spent 4 days here and 4 days at the hotel Alhambra and we greatly preferred this hotel. I'll review Alhambra separately. We would return to Hacienda Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Paradise was great for our 2 night stay in January- although a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: HGH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Paradise in mid January. We were on our way to Tulum to a bed and breakfast there and decided to add a couple of days in Playa. All of the staff at Hacienda were just great. They were very communicative with me via the internet before we arrived, answering questions promptly. We were greeted very warmly upon our arrival and check-in went very smoothly. Our room was very pleasant and the bed was great. I really enjoyed the towel art each day and the extra of petals on the bed. The pool area is lovely and we enjoyed sitting on our little balcony. The high speed internet worked great- my Skype call to my daughter was better reception than when we are down the block from one another! The breakfasts were very nice and there was a good variety, with egg dishes as well. We really enjoyed the location- just a couple of blocks from 5th Ave. The walk to Mamita's beach club was short and our advertised free passes were exactly that. We had no problems with that at all, so I'm not sure what others were referring to. It was cool and windy the day we were there, but we went to the beach anyway and read our books there. The service was friendly and we enjoyed our time there. Our only negatives were that there was quite a bit of street noise in our room. We put on the air conditioner to try to block the noise, but it wasn't able to compete. And we could see how the air conditioner would not really cool the room as well as we would want in warmer months due to the location over the door in the foyer to the room. I would stay at the Hacienda again, but probably not in the summer (but we really like our room cool and quiet)

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: peggy34bc
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with another couple and had a great time,the rooms were clean cosy comfortable and the beds were so soft .this hotel is such a great value for money and it includes a great breakfast and free internet.checkin was a breeze and he even offered us cold drinks and wet clothes to wash up with. we walked the block over to 5th ave and had a great dinner and drinks at a cute mexican restaurant,we wanted to go for more margaritas and ended up near our hotel at another cute place.i had booked this place for our friends and us because of the awesome reviews on trip advisor and wasn't dissapointed.thanks hacienda for a great nites stay, if we are back at playa we will stay again...

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andbas
Reviews.Content: Hacienda Paradise in Playa del carmen is an excellent hotel for those of you interested in great guest service with no attitude. The Hotel is in the center of everything. The location is one block from Quinta Avenida and very close to the beach. It is easy access to the clubs, shops and entertainment throughout the Quinta. The Staff is highly attentive and overly considerate. The managers where so wonderful and like to establish a friendly and respectful relationship with every guest. One things to note. The pool there is not heated. I had no problem with that because neither is the ocean. I enjoyed the cool dip, especially when the weather was hot. I would highly recommend Bepe and his team at the restaurant, they do an excellent job and work really hard. I will stay there again. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: rcaj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night on Jan 9/10 so that we could enjoy Playa Del Carmen prior to going to our all inclusive resort for 6 days. We really enjoyed the hotel and thought the location was perfect for walking around Playa. Cleanliness, service and hotel rooms were excellent. We had a 1st floor room with 2 queen beds and the room was very spacious. It was great to be able to sit on our patio and enjoy the gardens and pool area. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, should give pass for free is advirtize for free”
Reviews.Author: sunglow
Reviews.Content: been to this hotel 4 times for long weekends to 12 days stay. Treated like family, clean hotel, great staff, great breakfast. small pool but i go for the beach. i dont understand all these comments about bugs and muskitos etc etc THIS IS OUT OF ANYBODY'S CONTROL. Can you stop moskitos from invading your backyard? or your house? or your garden? the one complaint i have about the hotel is that they always told me by email once i reserve that the pass to MAMITAS beach is FREE and it is not this is not good public relations

Reviews.Title: “Had some ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Robsgurl79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Hacienda Paradise due to the good reviews on Trip Advisor, and the fact that we were on a budget. I have to be honest, it did not quite meet my expectations, but it did have some good points. PROs: -Breakfast was AMAZING! Seriously, the best breakfast ever! It almost completely made up for all the things that went wrong. -Room was very clean -Check in was very speedy and efficient, and the desk staff were very friendly. They even caught a small glitch in our bill that kept us from being over charged. -All of the hotel staff seemed very friendly -Bed was comfortable -High speed internet in room worked very well. -Location was great, just far enough away from the main strip but still within close walking distance to everything - Air conditioning worked good after we got it going the first time -Courtyard area and pool was very nice, though we did not swim because the water was just a little too cold. I think its because it is mostly shaded Cons: -When we first arrived the room was very HOT, and had a musty odor to it. The odor did subside mostly after the room cooled off. -There is construction during the day inside the hotel next door, so there is a constant loud noise of jack hammers and saws through out the day. I think this issue is through out Playa, for there was a lot of construction everywhere -The courtyard has A LOT of bugs and we each received over 20 bug bites each. I am not sure what they are, but they look like small gnats that leave extremely itchy bites like mesquitos and our bug spray did not work against them. Our room was right next to the courtyard, so a few would frequently get in the room as well. One day inside the lobby my husband saw a huge swarm of them by the computers. I do want to say that the hotel may have little control over this, someone mentioned all of the area were having problems with these bugs. - Some of the hotel staff spoke very little english. -The "Free pass to Mamita's beach club" Is not free, and we had trouble understanding our final bill because the staff at checkout did not speak english. -Housekeeping did not change the sheet at all. I had to ask for clean sheets and they got very itchy after a day or 2. - We left a tip for the housekeeping staff that was taken and the room was left uncleaned. They promptly cleaned the room after we notified them, but this made me feel very uneasy like someone just came in and stole it. We also felt bad for the maid that was made to clean, for I am sure she did not take the tip, so we went ahead and re-tipped her. I would suggest waiting til the last day to tip housekeeping. - Another issue we had was that they maid accidently threw away our tour ticket to Chichen Itza, which led to confusion and we were sent on the wrong bus. By the time they figured out we were with the wrong company and they took us back to the hotel, our real tour van had already left. It was our last day too so we did not get to go to Chichen Itza at all, (one of the main reasons we decided to go to the Rivera Maya).The concierge did refund our money for the tour along with about $10 extra also for us having to take a cab back from our van breaking down for another tour. I feel they could have compensated a little better, also with the fact that they told us at check in that the Beach passes were free, only to charge them to the bill later. I am really indifferent on whether or not I would reccomend this hotel. I guess I would say yes due to the fact that we booked the "Xperince deal" which saved us about $20 a night. If we had paid anymore than $80 a night I would probably not reccomend it, but for the price, it really wasn't that bad. I think alot of it was out of there control, and probably have the same issues at alot of the boutique hotels. I am glad we did not stay at a resort though, for alot of it was an adventure and the experience of being in a foreign country. If your coming from the US or Canada, you will probably have to settle for a little less comforts than you are used to . I will say the food both at the hotel, and in Playa was so excellent, and the beauty of the area makes it all worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: travelinghomebody09
Reviews.Content: My mother, daughter and myself thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hacienda Paradise. The Master Suite had everything we needed for a wonderful vacation. The hotel enjoys an excellent location, only a couple blocks from the beach and one block from the 5th Avenue shopping district. Happily, Hacienda Paradise is located close to the quieter end of 5th Avenue, it gets glitzier as you walk further from the hotel. I can't say enough about the concierge service. Jorge made excellent suggestions for meals and outings. He always made sure that we had what we needed including reliable taxi service to and from our day trips. Breakfast was ample each morning. I'm not a big fan of "Continental Breakfast" so seeing eggs, yogurt, toast, french toast, pancakes, and fruit each morning was a treat. Beppe was a wonder, always buzzing around making sure that everyone had what they desired.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful experience and more”
Reviews.Author: AJD77
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitors to Riveria Maya, usually 2-3 times each winter, we decided to stay closer to the village, rather than one of the many all inclusive resorts in the area. With the help of friends we found this gem of a boutique hotel, one short block from the "famous fifth ave." center. Much to our additional pleasure was the outstanding services provided by the three owners...Beppe, Max and Guiseppe! Together with their impeccable staff, could not do enough to make our week there pure pleasure! We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, accommodations, and service!”
Reviews.Author: KJV24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our late fifties and have travelled extensively, experiencing many degrees of accommodations. For a non-mega resort, this property ranks at the top. Everyone, from housekeeping to the actual owners of this business, goes out of their way to ensure you have the best possible stay. They are truly sincere, not phoney, about seeing to your every need or concern. Our room was extremely well appointed and serviced each day to the maximum. The breakfast each morning was superb, offering authentic Mexican fare, as well as the traditional American favorites. Many thanks to Belam for the painless reservation process, and to Guiseppe, Pepe, Ebon, Cynthia, Leon, George, and Al...? for everything you did to make our stay most enjoyable. The "personal touch" that was shown to us, was extended to every guest during our entire stay at Hacienda Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and lovely”
Reviews.Author: Nassaubay
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Thursday and our resort is from Sat. to Sat. So we stayed at Hacienda for 2 nights. The staff was outstanding and helped us with everything. My husband had a toothache and needed a dentist. Not only did they reccomend one, they walked him down the street to where she was located. That is service. The room was a bit worn but beautiful, soft beds, spa bath products, lovely bathroom with large shower. The hotel also offered a continental breakfast which was perfect to start the day. It is in town, close to 5th but not noisy at all. We would stay here again if we ever arrive early again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming! Rustic & quaint with all the super-deluxe luxury and service”
Reviews.Author: maryann617
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice... Staff is so friendly and helpful. Thanks to Aldo at the front desk for his hospitality and to Christian at the travel desk who told us about the free public beach... Just as an FYI, we were accosted by the rental car agency for a $20 breakfast with champagne and snorkeling... turned out to be a huge time share scam with el cid hotel... Luckily we didn't waste any time and instead headed out to Akumal, where you can swim with turtles and snorkel / dive the 2nd largest reef in the world (for free). You just swim out there... It's paradise. The breakfast was OK... I've had better... but they have an EXCELLENT salsa, the best I've ever had. I love spicy and this is the only salsa that actually made my eyes water. The rooms are great... bed is super-comfortable... I love how they've decorated with distressed furniture & oversized pillows. Bathroom was spacious... very modern with travertine tile... Hotel was immaculate. They even had free computers to use. The only issues I had were with noise. We had room #7 which was right by the road and it was kinda loud in the morning, and also it was on the ground floor. I would choose one of the second floor rooms in the future. Overall though, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “My Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: cblvs
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best staff of any hotel I've ever stayed in EVER! Mauricio was not only helpful and knowledgeable but was funny, bilingual and is someone I now consider a friend. Cynthia, also so sweet and bilingual, went WAY above and beyond for my birthday and made it the most special birthday I have ever had. My room was decorated everyday with balloons, rose petals, fantastic towel designs and even a cake. I thank all the staff again and again and again. This hotel had free internet, beautiful bathrooms, very comfortable beds, beautiful furnishings, flawless, easy, check in and out, cable t.v., a phone in the room, great pool, other fun and friendly guests that were our age, a free breakfast, a concierge, less than a block from the market and 12th street, a sister hotel just blocks away on the beach with a beautiful beach bar and beach loungers. Our hotel even provided umbrellas! I will never stay anywhere else in Playa Del Carmen and will be sure to send everyone I know! Thank you, thank you, thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jquinn23
Reviews.Content: Some of the friendliest staff I have encountered whilst travelling in a large number of hotels worldwide. Located in the right end of town - away from the majority of hustlers and touts, and with a laarge number of nicer restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: DERodriguez
Reviews.Content: Our only regret is that we could not stay longer in this excellent hotel. Great service, professionalism, value for our money

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: murphy_sa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week recently and I have to say the staff were second to none. They couldn't do enough for us. The room itself was great, lovely personal touches - towel animals shaped on the bed, flowers on the pillows etc. Shower and bathroom were lovely. They leave a complimentary fruit basket when you arrive too. There is a safe too that fits a laptop and complimentary wi-fi in the rooms as well as free-to-use PCs in the lobby. Breakfast in the the restaurant outdoors next to the pool every morning was a great way to start the day. Location wise it's right on 4th so only a block from all the restuarants and bars on 5th, also only 2 or 3 blocks from the beach - the hotel has a deal with Marmitas (sp?!) beach club so you get free loungers and umbrellas with a coupon the hotel gives you. All in all had a fantastic time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully unforgetable”
Reviews.Author: SALGreece
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the mastersuite which was delightful -light,spacious,characterful with mexican wooden furniture, lovely balcony overlooking the garden and pool, superb large comfortable bed and great bathroom - especially the jacuzzi complete with candles. All of this was rendered even more romantic by the artistic use of flowers and petals to decorate the bed and bathroom, together with delightful creation of dolls and creature made from towels, each day. My husband was more impressed by the ipod dock and little computer provided! Without exception the staff were very nice and helpful, including help with hire cars and tours, and we were very grateful to be accompanied to the police station when we commited a parking offence! The hotel is ideally situated for the beach, 5th Avenue and everything you need is within easy walking distance. Whatever the hotel doesnt have itself ,an arrangement has been made to use facilities elsewhere.I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and would definitely stay there again myself if Im ever lucky enough to have another holiday in Mexico. Playa del Carmen is a very nice area to be based in offering sea and beaches,good food,ready access to Mayan sites and a huge number of adventure and eco places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Graciela003
Reviews.Content: We spent an entire week here and it was great! The room was very spacious and clean, with a very convenient small refrigerator. All the rooms are overlooking the interior garden with a swimming pool and beautiful tropical plants. The location is very convenient, only one block from 5th avenue with all its boutiques and restaurants, and 3 blocks from the beach. Also the hotel offers free breakfast and has free access to the Mamitas Beach Club with complimentary beach towels. The staff is very friendly and warm, always trying to help. When my son got sick Pepe, the food manager, prepared for him a very good tea that really helped him out. We are really recommending this hotel to all our friends and relatives, and will be back! It has great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Loved My Stay”
Reviews.Author: succeed_2
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. This was my first visit to Playa del Carmen, and I wasn't sure what to expect, so chose this hotel based on the ratings here on Trip Advisor. Boy, did I choose well ! This hotel is perfectly situated. It's just a block from Fifth Avenue (where everything happens), but far enough away from the town center so that you don't get any noise AT ALL. The most excellent Mamita's Beach Club and northern section of the beach (which MANY say is the best part of the beach) is only about 2 blocks away. And the Hacienda Paradise is close to many restaurants and shops. The rooms are kept spotlessly clean, and yes, the bathroom had marvelous tile. The bed was amazingly comfortable. There was an in-room safe, fridge, excellent television, we couldn't have been happier. We were on the ground floor, so we only had to exit our patio door to get to the pool (nice pool for a relaxing swim in the evening). We only saw the pool being used one other time, yet we didn't even hear it until we opened our patio door. The front desk staff were wonderful. The 2 (yes two) free computers with internet access in the lobby were a god-send for keeping in touch with what was going on back home. And the breakfast on the patio area was simple, yet more than adequate. Everyday there was a great selection of food, and they started putting it out early (7:00-7:30a.m.) so we could always eat and then dash out to our day's activities. I would give this hotel 10 stars if I could - our stay was amazingly comfortable. And we felt safe as well. If I ever go back to Playa del Carmen, I'm definitely staying at the Hacienda Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: IAH
Reviews.Content: A first stay for me at Hacienda Paraside but it won't be the last! From the moment we walked in the door at check in to the moment we had to say goodbye, the staff could not have been more attentive! The rooms are beautiful! Comfortable beds, clean, nice bathrooms with hot water all the time! The complimentary full breakfast was a great way to start the day! The pool was clean and refreshing for a quick dip from a long day at the beach! Beach towels are provided for the beach or the pool! Hacienda Paradise is also a pet friendly hotel, one of only a few in Playa del Carmen! If you want to travel with your small pet, Hacienda Paradise is the place to stay! I also had a wonderful massage at the hotel for $400MXN / hour. So relaxing after a long beach day! I would not hesitate to tell friends and family to stay here on their upcoming trips to Playa! I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel - You Will Not be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Olonguapo
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend here in early September celebrating our 15th anniversary and it was wonderful. The Master Suite is spacious, clean, comfortable and packed with every amenity you could ask for (and then a few extras). My wife is enrolled in an online academic program that requires daily class participation, the hotel’s wireless internet service worked flawlessly 24 hours a day everywhere she went. Looking for a good way to start the day? Their free buffet breakfast is terrific and should easily satisfy most travelers. However if you ask, they will cook something extra on the side to meet your special needs. In fact, everywhere you look; the staff is very attentive and will do anything within their power to make your stay pleasant. When we told the hotel that it was our anniversary, they baked us a Cake and made a Flower Bouquet to help us celebrate. Bottom line, if you are looking for a small, convenient, customer oriented hotel .. we highly recommend the Hacienda Paradise. Your stay will be terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place in Playa”
Reviews.Author: rachy3582
Reviews.Content: After three long flights, a bus ride, and a half mile walk my boyfriend and I were ready for some relaxation. Upon entering Hacienda Paradise, looking very tired and very sweaty, the front desk person immediately handed us damp, cool towels and glasses of orange juice. This just simply set the tone for our stay at Hacienda Paradise. The air conditioning was excellent in our room, the complimentary water was just what we needed, the included breakfast was delicious, the concierge was incredibly helpful, the complimentary beach towels and free access to Mamitas beach club was perfect! Even with all of the sand we tracked into our room every evening it was still kept spotless. The location was also perfect. One block off of the craziness of Avenida 5 and also a little further down the Calle's to the slightly less touristy area. I loved this hotel and if I ever come back to Playa, I will surely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: MasCiudades
Reviews.Content: This was my first time on Playa del Carmen, so picking an hotel was kind of complicated, finally decided for Hacienda Paradise and I must say it was a great selection, all positive reviews were very accurate. The location is pretty good, if your looking for nightlife or just want to spend some time on the beach (the rate include the beach club) everything is walking distance. The staff were so kind and helpful. The only thing I would change is the temperature of the air conditioner, it has to be cooler, everything else is a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: Since the moment myself and my wife arrived the scene was set for our stay! It was my 30th birthday the day we arrived and once we had checked in we went to our room (#22) to settle in. Waiting for us there were six of the staff (who had previously decorated our room with balloons and streamers) singing me happy birthday! What a nice surprise! As was the birthday cake and bottle of wine!!! The hotel is clean, well looked after and perfectly located for the restuarants and bars of la Quinta Avenida and just a 5 minute walk to the beautiful beach. The customer service throughout was exemplary and so personal it was lovely. Every morning on the way to the delicious breakfast (good selection of hot and cold, Mexican and cereals) we were greeted with a smile and a friendly chat from all staff we encountered. We went to Playa to relax for a few days and our stay in this hotel certainly helped. Great hotel, perfect location, amazing customer service...could not have asked for more!! Muchas gracias a todo el staff! Looking forward to our next stay......

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better - pool was dreadful”
Reviews.Author: justin44
Reviews.Content: My GF and I left Cozumel early to return to Playa the night before our flight back to the states. The main reason we did this was to make sure we made our flight and to experience a hotel with a nice pool, which our Cozumel digs were lacking. Unfortunately, the pool at the Hacienda Paradise was disgusting - we were totally disappointed. The pool was very dirty - the water was so murky that we didn't dare use it. Also, the first room that we were put in (room #8) smelled disgusting - so bad that we had to switch rooms. Aside from these 2 drawbacks the hotel was satisfactory - the rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable (6 out of 10 rating) and the staff was helpful. Also, the breakfast was very good (9 out of 10 rating).

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: oksk8r
Reviews.Content: Well appointed rooms, comfortable and quiet surroundings, delicious gourmet breakfast included in price, great value for the price, but none of that comes close to the outstanding service from all the staff. During our entire stay we were treated with the utmost care and friendly service by everyone from the front desk, to the concierge, the kitchen staff, and the general manger. We will definitely be back and highly recommend to anyone visiting Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “a true pleasure”
Reviews.Author: benjamen
Reviews.Content: this was our first time in mexico so we were'nt sure what to expect. upon checking in the staff did all they could to make up welcome. they provided fresh juice and helped with our suitcases. the continental breakfast was excellent and the staff very helpful. the surroundings were so relaxing with pools and lounging chairs. the location of this hotel was great for shopping on 5 avenue. i would recommend this hotel to all and look forward to staying again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and superb”
Reviews.Author: Uvatango
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past week and were very happy with our choice. The hotel is small but big in service. Very cordial and friendly staff, starting with the front desk, restaurant staff and cleaning people. You can even get to see the owners in the amenities. Great location, one block from 5th Ave and three blocks from the best beach there, Playa Mamitas. Breakfast was good, didn't use the hotel restuarant for dinner, too many choices out there! Would definetely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “All the positive reviews are true!!”
Reviews.Author: chicagoroxie
Reviews.Content: We loved our 7 night, 8 day stay. Everything was paradise. The staff were friendly, caring and helpful, the breakfast was ample and delicious, the grounds and rooms were very clean, internet access was great and the room was comfortable. Even our 2 little problems (a ceiling fan made noise and no clock in the room) were tended to quickly and satisfactorily. Our only suggestion would be to add a full length mirror somewhere in the room. The mirror over the sink was too high for my short frame to get a full length look at how I was dressed. However, this is a very minor complaint! The hotel was a quick walk to the beach and all the excitement of 5th Avenue, but quiet at night for sleeping. We would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location for a fantastic price!”
Reviews.Author: ZENIandDAVE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had booked the Hacienda Paradise Boutique for 2 nights but quickly extended our stay to 3 nights! Our room was simple, modern and most importantly, immaculate! The price was great for budget-conscious travelers who are not willing to compromise comfort and cleanliness. The staff was friendly without being overbearing. We enjoyed nice complimentary breakfast buffets on the small poolside garden area of the hotel. Hacienda is located just steps away from the trendy Quinta Avenida in Playa del Carmen, which means you can actually get a good night's sleep and still be in the heart of all the action whenever you feel like it. The hotel is also very close to Mamita's Beach Club on Playa Tukan. We will definitely go back to Hacienda Paradise Boutique whenever we need a Playa del Carmen fix!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice & clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: pgurnani1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with a friend and we had a great time. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodated our needs. The hotel was also very clean. The landscaping was pretty, the pool was clean and the breakfast was good. The staff even made made-to-order breakfasts without any additional charge! I would recommend this hotel to a friend and would stay there again if I go back to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Third times a charm!”
Reviews.Author: Taurusman
Reviews.Content: After reviewing numerous hotels for two weeks prior to our vacation, we selected Hacienda Paradise Boutique Hotel because of all the great reviews. This was our third trip to Playa del Carmen which we find to be very charming with great restaurants, shopping and people. Upon our arrive at the Hacienda Paradise we were impressed by the cleanliness of the lobby and the enthusiasm of the receptionist. We quickly checked in and were guided to our room. Just as the description on the website, we felt like the room was exactly as portrayed. The first night we stayed on the lower level and changed to an upper level room the following night. The was nothing wrong with the first room except we wanted to have the view from above. Everything in the room was clean and well cared for. Plenty of space to store clothes and a very comfortable firm bed. The bathroom has a shower only but it approx. 4' x 4' and has two shower heads for variety. The rooms are outfitted with plenty of lights and a decent air conditioner. Each morning we enjoyed the home cooked buffet that included eggs, delicious bread pudding, crepes, yogurt, cereal, plus a variety of fruits. There was also a great selection of coffee! The staff was detailed and mingled with the guest to make sure everything was to their satisfaction. This hotel is not large, I think about 30 rooms, so the hotel staff to guest ratio was great. We commented on how many people worked there paying attention to every detail possible. If you are new to Playa the concierge located in the lobby will help you book some of the great activities. During our stay there was some construction that was finishing up right next to this hotel. Originally we were concerned that this would disrupt our pool time but that was not the case. Most of the building that faces this hotel has been completed. The pool is small but nice. There is a lot of shade throughout the day around the pool so sun worshipers beware. Obviously the beautiful beaches are better for sunning and enjoying people watching. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay away from the 5th ave. noise, this place will certainly accommodate you. It's very close to the beach and all the shopping you can want. We rented a scooter from American Car Rental [--] located on 26th and 5th avenue near Starbucks.. For about $25 per day and minimal gas you can cruise around Playa and points beyond. Just be careful not to go to far north of the resort area in some of the poorer area's since it's not safe. If you are looking for an inexpensive massage, try Veronica's on 5th and 20th. For $29 per hour they will give you a great massage with a very clean environment. We did a couples massage that had adjoined rooms. Another spa is Spa Itza. We have been there two years straight and enjoy the staff and sunning on the roof top deck that has open showers, steam room, and sauna. We will certainly stay again at the Hacienda Paradise Hotel on our next stay in 2010. The price was a bit less than the other hotels we have stayed at and provided superior service. Lou Baltimore, MD

Reviews.Title: “GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: frenchy06Nice
Reviews.Content: Just a good place to stay for few days in playa we spend few days there and we were very satisfied well located good staff clean good breakfeast the only bad points are the air cond.make a lot of noise and the litlle swimming pool we negociate a good price too so it was a good choice for us

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Hidden Jem In Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Syed-Rizvi
Reviews.Content: What I can I say but that it was a great experience....... The staff amazing and helpful, Facility well kept and clean, AC is nice and cool (takes a bit to get going but it really cools the room) Great breakfast buffet Nice maid services Location was excellent - a 5 minute walk from everything you need Scuba, Jet ski, beach volleyball etc and all the shops you will ever need Very Accommodating staff and management I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for 5 star service at a 3 star price. Loved our stay Thanks Hacienda Paradise Syed and Irm

Reviews.Title: “The greatest place to stay in Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: babykn
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hacienda Paradise boutique hotel on Calle 22nd are the most kind and pleasant poeple, from the front desk to the brakefast manager everybody makes you feel like a VIP. The service is as good as a 5 stars hotels that charges 4 times more.  The facilities are very clean and well maintained, the decor has a calm contemporary feel and look. I finally found a place to stay everytime I come to Playa. Keep it up guys great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great value: clean, well located, nice staff, nice food”
Reviews.Author: memoi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hacienda paradise for 4 nights. We had the continental breakfast included, but it turned out to be this great buffet that changed everyday., which made the value even better. Although the hotel is not right on the beach, it is just a couple of blocks away, and the beach club costs less than 5$ a day for 2 chairs and an umbrella. The rooms are really cute and clean, beds comfy, and the small pool is perfect for a quick dip. This is great for travelers who want to be just outside of the main tourist street. You have the easy access without the noise. And the staff recommended good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “relaxin at the hacienda”
Reviews.Author: sabad
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 8 nights in june and had a great time.front lobby was very helpful,breakfast was good,pool though small was good,all in all a very cozy and peaceful hotel with the staff going out of their way to make you feel comfortable.we stayed 3 nights in a normal room and 5 nights in the main suite(which was booked before that) and just loved it.the suite apart from a bar,big lcd tv in the living room and jacuzzi in the bathroom,also had it's own computer which made life even more comfortable.it's also right next to 5th avenue but in a quieter section so no noise and just a couple of blocks from the beach(got free vouchers for beach loungers).have already recommended the place to friends.big thank you to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “great value boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimandpetebunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in July for our honeymoon. It's a great place because it is super clean, modern amenities, management and breakfast wait staff are very friendly (great cappucino!!), the breakfast is great, free internet in lobby, very helpful concierge (she is both a travel agent and concierge, but does the concierge side without pushing tours... so is good), and the location is perfect - it is only 3 mins walk to 5th ave, so you are close to it but not right on it, like so many of the other hotels in Playa. So it is quieter but still really a nice area. Also close to Mamitas Beach Club. Cons were - I got bitten a lot by mosquitos at the internet terminal, but then again, I get bitten so easily. My husband didn't have the same problem... but if you sensitive just limit your time online (go to the beach!!). The restaurant only does breakfast, but there's plenty around the hotel. The water pressure isn't great, and takes a while for hot, hot water. And some of the front counter staff are a little... errrr... slow. BUT, that said I would stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, conveenient, cozy, friendly, good brekfast”
Reviews.Author: GlobtrottingViking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Paradise Hotel from 07/25/09 to 07/31/09. My wife, our two children (4 and 6) and I, and our friends with their two children (3 and 6) had a great week at the Hacienda. My wife and I had one of the rooms with two queen size beds, and our friends had the master suite. If you can get it, I can highly recommend the master suite. The rooms and hotel in general was clean and in good repair. The staff was super nice, and the concierge helped us with arranging rental cars, suggested restaurants, helped with setting up dive trip at the last minute, etc. The hotel has a very nice court yard where the bar and the pool are located. The pool was great for the kids; although it does not have a shallow where the kids could reach the bottom (my kids can swim so this was not a big issue for us). The hotels Wifi worked great with my iPhone so I could upload pictures to Facebook without paying ATT crazy amounts of money. The beach is just a short walk, and the beach club was nice. It can be a little hard to get a spot under a shade, but it was not a big deal. The hotel is also close to 5th avenue but not close enough for it to be noisy. I can highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loreSanAntonio_Tx
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel. The service is excellent, great location (one block from the 5th ave), very clean and nice rooms and excellent price....great option if you are plannng to stay in Playa

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: malinjacques
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hacienda Paradise on a recent visit to Playa del Carmen. The hotel is pleasant enough - it ticks all the boxes without exuding masses of charm or being particularly memorable in its own right. You could do a lot worse than this place and I doubt anyone would regret staying here, but it just did not provide the sort of colonial charm that the word "hacienda" conjures up. There were other slightly weird aspects that did not detract from our visit but might annoy others - the hotel is nicely finished but the location of the air-conditioning in the room means that it is not wholly effective and takes a while to cool the room down. In our bathroom, both of the taps in the hand basin were hot water taps. The television reception is not great and there aren't many english channels. There was no access to powerpoints on one side of the bed (sounds harmless unless you have a sleep machine or similar). You don't have to pay for bottled water replaced in the bathroom but you do for water replaced in the living room. Finally the staff, whilst all very friendly and helpful, have a slightly vacant air to them, like they are talking to the person behind you. This sort of thing would usually go unnoticed, except the hotel presents itself as a luxury hotel, which leaves you scratching your head a little. None of this, of course seriously detracted from our stay and you can expect to have a pleasant time here, without being bowled over by an incredible experience. (oh yes - and now having looked at the photos - note that there is only breakfast at the hotel (included) and no room service (not that we care but the photos make it seem like there is)). It doesn't matter - there are heaps of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant and restful stay!”
Reviews.Author: aemalone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hacienda Paradise Boutique for one night during our vacation to Mexico a couple weeks ago. We arrived very late at night and really just wanted to get to our room. The front desk staff was helpful, showed us to our room and explained where we could park. As with most hotels the air conditioning was not on until our host showed us into our room, at which time he powered the AC on. Unfortunately our room never cooled off very well – even the next morning, after having the air on throughout the night. The mini bar was well stocked with snacks and a variety of drinks; the bathroom and room were very spacious; and despite the location in downtown Playa, the room was very quiet and peaceful through the night. Breakfast was great the next morning and was included with our stay. They offered eggs, toast, cereal, yogurt, chicken tortillas, pancakes, etc. Our stay was very brief, but it was restful and the staff were very helpful. Pros: Quiet, despite location. Great location if you are interested in shopping or eating downtown. Spacious rooms and bathrooms. Plenty of snacks and drinks in the minibar. Great breakfast. Cons: A/C didn't cool well. Guests have to use the computer in the lobby for internet - no wireless. Parking on the street - may pose a problem during busy times.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: cspain1
Reviews.Content: We found Hacienda Paradise here on Tripadvisor. We were not looking for a big touristy resort-style hotel so this was perfect for us. We were able to get a good deal through Expedia and booked the Master Suite. Let me start with the “negative” (if you could call it that). Yes, there is construction going on next door (and everywhere else in Playa!) however, the only time I heard slight noise is when I was using the pool during the day (about 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.) Nothing out of the ordinary or unbearable. Now the positives…The Master Suite was beautiful!! We had two separate rooms (a living room and a bedroom). Each suite room had its own flat screen t.v. and we even had a mini computer with complimentary internet use. We had everything we needed and more! We were welcomed with a fruit basket in our room and delicious exotic teas. The toiletries smelled wonderful and did wonders for my hair. The hotel grounds are beautiful. The hotel is small and quiet and the pool is perfect for a dip after a long walk and sunbathing. It was usually empty or we only had to share it with maybe 2 more people. I must say that the staff was very helpful and friendly. We wanted to visit Tulum but wanted to drive ourselves and Aurea, one of the staff members was able to get us a good deal on a rental car and a trip to/from the car rental place. Anything we needed, they were readily available to work with us. The hotel is run in a very relaxed manner. We arrived very early and were able to check in right away, without issues. The checkout too was quick and simple. This was our first time in Playa so we had quite a few questions. The staff was always very helpful and willing to share insights with us. The staff seemed happy to be there. They joked with each other and us (in a professional manner) and were always smiling. Mamita’s Beach club was heavenly. We usually got there in the afternoon so we only got the back row chairs/umbrellas but it was great. The hotel has vouchers that will save you some money otherwise, beach chairs are 30 pesos each and thatch roof umbrellas are also 30 pesos. Or you can lounge in style and pay 200 pesos for the bed loungers and retractable umbrella. I cannot say enough good things about or experience at Hacienda Paradise. The room was beautiful and homey and the staff was excellent. Although part of me doesn’t want to share this great place with anyone, I would recommend Hacienda Paradise to anyone visiting playa. I will be back to Hacienda Paradise, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tisha50
Reviews.Content: Clean, simple and yet quite elegant, this hotel fit the bill for us with just an overnight stay in Playa. One block back from 5th Avenue..and two blocks from the water..this hotel was the perfect choice for us. We would stay there again if the situation arises. Thank you Hacienda Paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday despite the over-hyped influenza scare!”
Reviews.Author: FlorZulberti
Reviews.Content: Not one to fall for mass hysteria, May proved to be an ideal time for us to travel to Playa del Carmen because we managed to take advantage of great discounts and everyone was super friendly and welcoming, particularly at this hotel. With its tasteful (African-inspired) decor and modern comforts, this four-star hotel was a real eye-opener to us because it is centrally located 1 block from the main (5th) Avenue, the rooms and overall ambiance is elegant and clean, and the staff is very professional (which is not common). This hotel also offers a reasonable-sized pool, an inner garden and a restaurant that promotes special menus such as “Spicy Night in Paradise”. Overall, we felt that this hotel was great value for our money and that it was the perfect time to visit it if you are like us and do not enjoy vacationing with the masses.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Artie09
Reviews.Content: First off the staff deserves kudos for their excellence in service, thanks again Cynthia and Max for all your help! Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and luxuriously appointed and the rooms with balconies have a nice view of the lovely swimming pool.
