I appreciated free access to the internet, the coffee and tea station in the lobby and the delicious full breakfast prepared by the cook that was included with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff”
Reviews.Author: LaPlaya81
Reviews.Content: I would like to say THANK YOU for a make a good time in the hotel. Thanks to staff, specially to Cynthia for helping with our problems about luggage and renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “a unique pet friendly hotel in playa del carmen”
Reviews.Author: salpresti
Reviews.Content: regardless of the travel advices i decided to go back to my favorite mexican spot to enjoy the good weather of these days. This time I went with the latest newcomer in the family. A fox terrier everyone envies! Hacienda Paradise is one of the very few small hotels in playa del Carmen accepting pets. It was really hard to find other hotels on the web and sometimes it looks as if the majority of them are not really much concerned about them. All the staff are extremely corteous and ready to make you really feel home.I already was here a few months ago but I have to say that they're really trying to specialize in market niches hard to be satisfied. If I had no enough guarantees on the services they can provide, including dog sitting (by expert hands and pets lovers), I would not simply have travelled with a pet. Well done and will be back again soon. I and Foxie can't thank you enough for the good care you have taken on us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HenrikM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with cozy rooms and friendly staff. Nice swimming pool with sun beds. Very convenient with free wireless Internet connection. Ok breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: JoTravelnut
Reviews.Content: We looked for months for a place to stay in Playa del Carmen on our first trip to the Mayan Riviera and found the Hacienda Paradise Hotel. What a find! The staff are fantastic! We can't say enough about them. The rooms are super clean and really large (we stayed in the King Size room #17). Free Wireless internet in our room was soooo great to have to keep in touch with family while away. The free coffee/tea/water station in the lobby running 24/7 was very welcomed after a long day. Karma Trails were great. We booked transportation to and from the airport with them, and it was perfect. Drivers were excellent. We also booked our trip to Chichen Itza with them and they were very accommodating when we had to change dates. The entire stay was absolutely perfect!! Thanks to all the Staff and Management at the Hacienda!!! We can't WAIT to return!!

Reviews.Title: “divers in playa”
Reviews.Author: twindivers
Reviews.Content: During our first time in Playa del Carmen, we probably received the warmest possible welcome at Hacienda Paradise. Since the beginning at our check in, we have been accompanied through our holiday in a very attentive way by a very well trained and skilled staff. Karmatrails, the in house travel consultant also guided us through all our excursions, especially when planning our diving. All transfers were punctual, and the whole organization made things real easy in all occasions. We strongly suggest this hotel to all those travelling to this part of the world for the first time: you're in good hands!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jimandcheryl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another wonderful stay at Hacienda Paradise. We have found this little hotel to be convenient, well maintained, comfortable and staffed by wonderful people. Probably the best thing about Hacienda Paradise are beds. Most hotels in Mexico have a lot to be desired when it comes to a mattress, but Hacienda Paradise has very comfortable mattresses. The staff always is friendly and the spa offers a fantastic massage for $30 US. My only hope is Hacienda Paradise remains a bargain and continued great service...we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful option in Playa.”
Reviews.Author: vailtraveler81658
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to what we had heard was a growing Playa del Carmen. At the suggestion of a friend, we decided to try the Hacienda Paradise. After being there, we are so glad that we did. The hotel, while being an older building, had all the charm and many of the same ammenities of a newer property. The location, a bit off of the busiest section of town, cannot be beat. The staff is courteous, accomodating and all speak English quite well making us non-Spanish speaking guests very comfortable. As others have noted, the beds are quite comfortable and the space in the rooms is quite nice. Lots of hangers in the closet, a great safety box that is easy to use and a mini fridge are all little things that make a big difference. If I have any complaints at all it's that the A/C, while constantly running...is not always great at circulating through the room. It is located in the short hallway right over the door to the room and with only a ceiling fan to circulate...many times the hallway was freezing and the room was still quite warm. I think that they are working on the efficiency of that system however. Overall a wonderful stay in a very clean, quiet and enjoyable hotel. As previously noted, don't let the concerns about the nearby construction worry you. Most of the structural work seems to be done. We didn't have a single morning where we were bothered by noise or otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find!”
Reviews.Author: Jason67
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally courteous and professional. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Very comfortable beds. Lovely, big bathroom. Good basic breakfast included. One block off the busy fifth avenue, but our room facing the pool was quiet. About a five minute walk to the beach. Stayed at five hotels under $150 a night during a driving trip around the Yucatan, and this was by far the best. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted and needed”
Reviews.Author: Tlee924
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to Playa Del Carmen, but it was our first time staying in a hotel that wasn't on the beach. Playa is growing at a tremendous rate and we wanted to stay away from the bus depot and the boom boom night clubs and Hacienda was the perfect location. We were greeted upon arrival with drinks, cold cloths and smiles. The staff here is very accomodating and extremely friend. I had read a "few" reviews here and Giuseppe's name had been mentioned so I asked to meet the man himself. Giuseppe seemed to be a fairly busy man, but always made time to stop and say hello and ask how the stay was going. And of course, I can definitely appreciate that. The rooms were filled with nice, but large furniture. The beds were extremely comfortable, which you probably know, reading other hotel reviews. A soft bed is difficult to come by in Mexico! Great bathrooms and yes, once I figured out how to turn on the AC, nice cool evenings encouraged a great nights sleep. Friends of ours canceled at the last minute and jokingly we asked Giuseppe for an upgrade since they've already paid. Well, he let us have the master suite one night since it wasn't booked. Yes, as a second room. It was VERY nice. Thank you Giuseppe!!! The pool was larger than I had thought since there were so many reviews that said it was tiny. It's not huge by any means, but you certainly won't hit the other side if you dive in! There is a bigger boutique hotel going up right next door so you see that from the pool but it wasn't a hassle to us at all. They kept the pool very clean and put out beach towels with flowers on them every morning. (just be careful in the walkway outside the rooms... it can be a little slippery if you've just gotten out of the pool. I found out the hard way, ouch! ) As for the "noise"... well you're IN playa.. so yes, you MIGHT hear an occassional car drive by, but it was by no means too much to handle. There's a cafe type area that serves a continental breakfast, nothing fancy, but it'll do the trick, especially for me, since I don't really "do" breakfast. Coffee, cereal, scrambled eggs, Chiliquito's... worked just fine for us! Mamita's beach club is a short walk away and you can get the discount coupons and beach towels at the front desk at Hacienda. Definitely a great deal! All in all, our trip to Hacienda Paradise was a fantastic one and we would most certainly go back. For claiming to be a "tiny" boutique hotel, it sure was big on customer service and satisfaction. Definitely a "must visit" in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: PlannerGeek
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of the in-town places in Playa -- it's relatively small and jammed into one of the blocks between the ocean and 10th Ave (the main N-S drag). In this case, it looks like an older motel was upgraded with "boutique" touches -- the usual boutique hotel stuff (rainshower shower head, quirky toiletries, Modern furniture in the lobby). On the outside, it still basically looks like a motel. But that's OK, because this place is still good. The location is great; it's maybe 2 long blocks to the beach (the North Beach, which is the nice one). They have a deal with one of the beach clubs where you can reserve a beach chair in the lobby at a discounted rate and then claim it when you hit the beach -- meaning you don't have to carry money with you. Because it's in the North End of Playa, it's quieter than the places right downtown -- but it's only 5-10 min walk to 10th St, so not really very far. Literally around the corner from 5th Ave. Really, I don't think the location could be improved on. Room was nice enough. If I had to complain, I'd say the water pressure could be better. The pool is OK, small. Breakfast was included, it was decent. Staff is very nice and helpful, and speaks great English. Recommended-

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: surfandsandals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hacienda Paradise during busy Easter week for two lovely nights and I couldn't recommend it more highly. Having traveled to Mexico, the Riviera Maya and Playa del Carmen several times, I have experience with the range of properties and pricing, and this little gem was a wonderful find. Greeted with fresh cold towels and bags taken to our room in a zip, we were given a quick tour of the intimate garden with a small but sparkling pool and comfortable lounge chairs decorated with fresh towels and flowers on each chair. Our room, as requested for my teenage niece and myself, had two double beds made in all white over-the-top thread count sheets with duvets and pillows galore. Everything in the room was brand new, from the wall mounted flat screen to the generously sized mini fridge and the bathroom with glass-doored shower, a real blowdryer, and luxurious organic bath amenities - shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and soaps. Fresh bottled waters for teethbrushing was included and refreshed daily. We enjoyed Mamitas Beach Club - so close to stroll to -and the discount and prepayment option provided by Hacienda Paradise was fabulous. We also experienced a smaller beach away from the action of Mamitas one day and enjoyed this as well. We loved being so close to Fifth Avenue and the shopping and restaurants, beach, etc. yet a bit removed from the frenzy and noise. We enjoyed quick dips in the pool after beach and after an evening of shopping and dining. Although Playa was very hot during our stay, we found our air conditioning kept us very cool when in the room and while sleeping. Showers were a joy with the huge rainshower shower heads and the additional hand shower option, and lots of hot water. Breakfast was delicious - french toast, a choice of two Mexican egg dishes, many choices of yogurt and cereals, fresh juices, delicious coffee, various breakfast cakes, etc and very well presented in the outdoor shaded area adjacent the pool. While there is obvious construction adjacent the hotel, we did not experience any problem with the noise. There is construction all over Playa right now so it would be difficult to stay in any of the small hotels in town and not be near noise from construction, and any construction noise we heard is much less than that of the Fifth Avenue if your hotel is right on the Avenue I had two massages in the small, tranquil massage space in the hotel for the amazing price of $35 for an hour from a professional and holistically oriented massage therapist. Bliss. Free wireless internet on the property was fantastic for me as I unfortunately had to connect for work, and the two computers in the lobby/salon area with free use and wireless were also a very nice plus. The management of Guiseppe and his charm, efficiency, and Italian sense of style and service create a calm and perfect environment at an incredible price value. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “a great find!”
Reviews.Author: and9080
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very happy with our choice. The hotel is located on the north end of 10th Ave and one street off of the main strip (5th Ave) - it's a bit quieter up north and we really appreciated that. It was nice to be able to get away from the activity on 5th Ave but yet the restaurants and shops were close. The hotel staff was very welcoming and helpful in choosing a restaurants or scheduling an excursion. We were glad to have the discount at the beach club - and used it almost every day. When we had read reviews were were a bit concerned about the construction situation, but really it wasn't an issue. Yes, they are building next door, but we were typically out of the room before the noise started in the morning and didn't find it to be a problem, it didn't take away from the comfort of the hotel. We had breakfast in the hotel each morning and it was quite sufficient. Tea, coffee and biscuits were also available in the lobby throughout the day and was nice to have the use of two computers with internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Hotel, helpful people, very clean hotel & grounds, spotless room.”
Reviews.Author: MargaretAnnG
Reviews.Content: My room on the courtyard was quieter than ones on the busy street side until construction on the addition started in the morning & went til about 5:30 PM. Pictures of poolside bar on website made it look like a convenient place for socializing, but it was only open on the one night a week when a special "Mexican Dinner" was held. I'd be much more likely to return if bar/restaurant was open all day/evening. Recommend for adults; wouldn't be much for kids to do. Convenient location a block from 5th Avenue pedestrian mall with restaurants, shopping & bars. I'd give it an 8 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful resting under the palms, right out of your room.”
Reviews.Author: romanusNewYork
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel where noise is banned, guests go unnoticed and service is efficient and discrete. Breakfast is American standard. The hotel is located one block from 5th avenue,( only for pedestrians), where main restaurants, bars and shops can be found. The beach can be reached with a short 5 minute walk. In the hotel lobby a dedicated desk can arrange for trips and excursions or simple information. Ideal for singles or couples who want to avoid disco music and confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: chloe212
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed for three nights in late March and were expecting something much better after reading the reviews. Let me first start with the positives: -clean & comfortable bedding -updated bathrooms -complimentary breakfast -VERY close to the main strip (5th Ave) -use of two computers with internet access Negatives: -the pool area is extremely small & not very well maintained. -the breakfast is very average (the items meant to be served hot are not even warm) & it is the same every morning -the A/C unit in the room is located at the door and it is extremely inefficient at keeping the room cool -there is A LOT of construction going on, literally one whole half of the building is in the proccess of being gutted.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding...”
Reviews.Author: CescoMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: Last year I had the privilege to stay at Playa del Karma and meet the hotest team of hoteliers in Playa . This year they took over this wonderful hotel and gave it the magic touch .These guys really know what you need in a hotel experience: Good size room ,fantastic king size bed, nice bathroom,great breakfast,great location , unobstructive service and the icing on the cake a fantastic price point.Without a doubt the best value in Playa del Carmen. We had a wonderful stay. Permit me to share with you some culinary experiences we experience that are worthwhile in Playa . -El Sarape on Juarez and 25 th street :The best tacos al Pastor sa hello to Ariel. -Tsuba shusi ont 5th and 38 street: Fantastic shusi and service ask for Daniele. -Mosquito Blue restaurant :Fantastic food and decor. A must see and do. -da Gigi : Constituyentes close to 10 th street .Best pizza in Playa -Il Carnicero :1st and 28 th street for steak lover specialy the rib eye one of the best I ever had -Best beach club :KOOL beach .The food is simply delicious Again a big thank you to Giuseppe,Max, Sabrina,Giordana and Nello for having made our vacation a success. Frédérique et Francois

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: travelinduoChicago
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Playa in the last year.  After staying at the same place every time, we thought we would change things up and stay here at Hacienda Paradise.  Well, we are sorry that we did.  Once we checked in and got to our room the first thing I spot on the corner of the floor was a dead cockroach!  I went back to the front desk to get the older gentleman who checked us in, he came to the room with me so I can show him.  He said nothing, he got a maintenence man to come clean it up.  Not even an I'm sorry, his only explanation was that they just sprayed the room for insects- that's it!  So of course we don't want to stay here, but at the same time do not want to go out and look for a new place....so we decide we'll go the beach and figure things out.  We go back to the front desk to pay the small fee of $1.50 each for beach towels,  you would think that this same man who was just in our room about the roach would comp our towels, but No he didn't.  This is unexeptable.  Terrible customer service.  In addition the the roach ordeal we were really disappointed with the pool, small, shady, not that clean.  Need less to say we spent the afternoon at the beach researching a new place to stay.  We found one nearby which was great

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a horrible city”
Reviews.Author: DSANYC
Reviews.Content: We spent the first half of our trip in Tulum, then went to Chichen Itza, and finished up in Playa del Carmen. Unfortunately, we were horrified by the town, but Hacienda Paradise is a beautiful, spotless, comfortable oasis with a friendly and helpful staff. It also has free buffet breakfast, which is a huge bonus. It is only a block away from Quinta Avenida, which is great if your idea of fun is hanging out in a US-style outdoor mall in Mexico. While this review is meant to plug Hacienda Paradise, you should know what you're getting into if you go to Playa del Carmen: drunk frat boys and sorority girls, American chain stores (Starbucks!), horribly overpriced restaurants, crowds, noise, Senor Frogs, traffic, "exclusive" beach clubs that charge you up the nose for a beach chair. If a relaxing beach vacation is what you want, go to Tulum or Puerto Moruelos. If you're looking for a "European" crowd, go to Spain. This place is full of rich, obnoxious, drunk Americans looking to get wasted and laid. There are much cooler parts of town further from the beach, but they don't redeem this town at all, which has been totally ruined by American-style consumerism. But, again, Hacienda paradise is an extremely nice hotel and a great way to escape the annoying parts of this town.

Reviews.Title: “I wish they would have given us a room on the pool side of the building.”
Reviews.Author: hSQU4RED
Reviews.Content: I was just looking through the reviews and we also just got back from Playa Del Carmen where we stayed at the Hacienda Paradise from March 6-March 14. In our reservations we also requested a room with a balcony and quiet poolside. When we arrived, we were given a room in the far back of the hotel with a small window and no balcony facing a side street where there was construction. When we requested that we could have our room changed to one with a balcony we were also told that the hotel was full and they could not fufill our request. I wonder why other people were given what they requested and we were not? This put a damper on the hotel for me. Yes, the continental breakfast was a very nice way to start each day. Yes, the location was awesome and yes, the free wireless was great, but we will not stay at this hotel again. There are many hotels in Playa that looked as nice and convenient. We will be trying something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, hospitable, quiet hotel just NW of 5th and Consitituion”
Reviews.Author: to-live-in-Europe
Reviews.Content: The online reservation process was quick, easy, friendly and efficient. Check in was the same with cheerful, Spanish/English speaking gentlemen offering fresh juice and cold towels, so welcome after traveling. Room was nicely appointed as described with organic toiletries; also fresh, plush, white, comfortable bedding with modern Euro designed furnishings. Balcony/patio, Cont. breakfast included in price/restaurant, wireless access, quiet rooms, non-smoking all added to the comfort. Proximity to the fabulous Playa Mamitas Beach was a huge plus. Only criticisms are that it is not as expansive or open as it appears in the photos and the air conditioners, located in the hallways, are less than optimally effective in the rooms themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-great price”
Reviews.Author: chitraveler23Chicago
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this hotel and it was great. The location was close to all the action but off 5th avenue which meant better prices. Breakfast was light but it did the job. Bathrooms were beautiful, beds soft and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Free internet and computers a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Understated Gem”
Reviews.Author: John1164
Reviews.Content: My wife and 18 month old son stayed here inFebruary. If you are looking for a small, boutique hotel with no frills (i.e., no big pool scene, no resort features), this is a great place. It is right off 5th avenue, on a quiet corner. Short walk to Mamitas beach club, short walk to all the action on 5th. Great place. Tons of Europeans staying here - it has that kind of feel. Well manged (Guiseppe does a great job making guests feel welcome and invited). The rooms themselves were clean (biggest concern always for my wife!! - she's a neat freak so when she says something is clean - it's clean). The room we stayed on had sliding doors to a small patio area on teh ground floor. I didn't see the high level rooms (floors two and three, but they all had sliding doors and a nice terrace). Don't worry about the noise, there is some construction going on, but we barely heard a knock - you don't spend so much time in teh room since you are at the beach, walking around 5th or on an excursion which the consierage (Christian) is great at helping to plan. I would stay here again - we come to Playa every year and this is a spot to return to. The best hotel I have stayed at in terms of value for money....unbeatable! an wi fi service which was an added plus...

Reviews.Title: “This place is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Mike99Md
Reviews.Content: It seems that this is a relatively new hotel because a lot of drivers, and visitors, did not know about the hotel. It is, however, not in a new building but it may be new management with a new name. The location is great; however, any hotel within the city of Playa Del Carmen has a great location because Playa is small and easy to get around. It is one block from Avenida Cinco, the main--traffic free--walking concourse. It is therefore 1 block from many restaraunts and 2 blocks from a Starbucks. The hotel is very nice and comfortable and considering the price this place is a steal. For example, whereas one of the local travel tour business offices wanted to charge us 110$ for a cab back to Cancun airport this hotel staff arranged it for 50$, less than half of that price. It was very comfortable and the king sized bed may be the largest bed we ever slept in. Directly above the bed was a fan which we kept running all night. The continental breakfast was a bit on the cheap side but for an additional 5 $ we bought an omelette to go with the breakfast. All in all a child free couple who does not want or need an all inclusive setting would like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hacienda Great Service Paradise”
Reviews.Author: happy2live
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hacienda for five nights starting on January 27th, 2009. Location is very central, only 1 block off 5th Avenue between 20 and 22nd streets. Check-in was quick and problem free. The room was plenty big with direct access to the pool area (our room was on the ground floor). Continental breakfast was served by the pool which was definitely a big plus. Top it off with free WiFi, and you couldn't ask for a better start to your morning. Hacienda has a relationship with Mamitas beach club and offers 50% discount on umbrella and lounge rentals. Check it out, it's great. We were only down for 4 full days and didn't feel like venturing beyond Playa but concierge is right there to help you book any trip possible. All is all, we enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “FAB!”
Reviews.Author: katalinaskye
Reviews.Content: Just outstanding. There is never an excuse for bad service and this proves it. I can't wait to go back!
